description:
Whenever I try a new boba shop, I usually play it safe and go with jasmine milk tea but this place was covered in cows so we figured we had to go with their specialty iced milk drinks.

Good call on our parts. I tried the BB iced milk with boba and pudding and it was delish! If you like things sweeter you have the option of adding caramel. I was wondering if I should get it half sweet like I normally do but the employee told us the iced milk wasn't that sweet by itself and he was right. They recommend you mix up the drink when you first get it. Make sure to get a little bit of everything in a sip to get the perfect mouthful. The velvety pudding and chewy sweet boba paired well with the more neutral iced milk. The employee offered to remake our drink if we thought it was too sweet but it ended up being perfect.

There's a few seats inside and some games available to use and play. Cash only!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
CASH ONLY (it's 2018, c'mon). 

The last time I came here was four years ago, but I decided to come here today because Tpumps is closed for renovation :'( I was shocked at how crowded the shop was compared to years before. It seems to have become a popular hangout spot for students to hang out after school and do homework in. 

We ordered a couple drinks. The yogurt drink is probably one of the most bizarre boba drinks I've had. I thought it would have more of a tea consistency, similar to the ones at other places. Instead, I felt as though I had stuck a straw through my carton of breakfast yogurt. To be fair, they did have a handwritten note under this menu item saying, "NOT YAKULT." 

The iced milk drink was good, similar to that of Purple Kow or Bubblecup. You can customize sweetness/ice levels, and the milk drink definitely would've tasted better if it had been less sweet. 

Service-wise...meh. There was only one employee working, so it was slow and we waited for over 15 minutes. The group that came in after us got all four of their drinks before we did, which was annoying. 

All in all, not a bad spot for your boba-fix if you're nearby, but otherwise, head elsewhere.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
I ordered three drink here and they were average. Customer service was also average and the cashier seem like she didn't want to be there. 

Drinks:
- Strawberry GT: This tasted like sugar in water. It didn't even take like strawberry. It came out room temperature and I had to ask for more ice.
- Honey Dew GMT: This tasted SUPER watered down. It was also room temp but I didn't want to ask for more ice because it was already watered down and I bought this to-go.
- Green Tea Lattea(?): It was just regular green tea with some sort of milk foam. My friend got this drink and said it didn't even taste like tea, it just tasted like milk. We asked the cashier to add ice for us and she said it doesn't come with ice.... What, 

Overall, I would not come back here. There was no tea flavor in any of the drinks which was a big disappointment.
author: Quynh L.

description:
We stopped by after dinner across the street because we had some diehard boba drinkers in our group.

There is limited indoor seating, which may be intentional to try and keep people from loitering around, but our group of four were forced to sit at the tiny kids table because it was too cold to sit outside.

I ordered a green tea lattea with grass jelly. This drink is already without sugar, which I appreciated, but I thought the whipped cream topping was a little too much. We figured the point was to mix the whipped cream down into the drink to make a 'milk tea' but it really didn't taste all that good. 

I think I'll be back to give their signature drinks a try, but I wasn't super impressed with their lattea.
author: Sherry L.

description:
This place is very convenient and satisfies my tapioca craving without having to drive my car

The lavender MT is always my to-go item but what has won me over is their strawberry BMT because it exactly like Tpumps on Irving! It is a hint sweeter than Tpumps so you can taste the strawberry flavor more here

Cup sizes are only 20-24oz

Cash only

Stamp card is available too
author: Yeanne L.

description:
I love this place.
I am very picky with the texture of boba and BB tea Station is one of the few place that I will go get boba.
author: Summer S.

description:
Decent boba drinks, but I have to agree with my other fellow Yelpers that it doesn't completely compare to any of the other known boba shops in the area.

Stopped here after a Saturday night dinner of noodles across the street to a surprisingly empty store. The menu seems pretty good, but is a bit hard to read with their color-coded diagram (you would think it would make it visually easier, but requires a longer glance through). 

I opted for the mango green milk tea with boba ($3.90). The mango drink itself was pretty good and creamy, but the boba was a little too soft and squishy for my liking. 

The price wasn't too expensive here, but I also think there are better places even on Irving nearby. I can see (and this reminds me of) this being a hangout spot for students just to get a convenient drink at, but I wouldn't drive specifically here to get it.
author: Clarissa C.

description: Cash ONLY.  Yummy boba tea drinks!  The menu is a little confusing if this is your first time here (like it was for me).  I simply picked out a C-7 for my choice.
author: Molly M.

description:
I saw the negative reviews and honestly thought this boba was going to be terrible but you know what?...it was pretty good and I'd venture to say it was above average in regards to their "regular" milk tea drink and also their boba was good too. 

I have it firmly at 6/6 for milk tea taste and boba taste which represent this humble opinion of mine on my ratings scale. . The layout is different with cows everywhere which reminded me of another spot on Kearney. 

Single worker was cool and it seems like it would be a chill place to study or do some work. 

Rod M tours San Francisco area in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below.  I have a more comprehensive Tiered Bay Area boba list 119 boba spots and counting. 

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #51  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible

* Please note that I like my boba a little bit sweet. I don't like it too milky, too strong of a tea taste or too watery.  I prefer fresh tasting larger "boba".  Powdery drinks (those places that simply have a plastic carafe that they pour out of ) and boba that tastes "old" get docked on my rating scale.  A place could have a higher Yelp rating than it's boba score would imply , if it sells things other than Boba that are good. 

SF/Daly City Rankings:

1 Itea  2 Caffe Central  3 Cool Tea   4 The Boba Shop  5 Little Sweet  6 Good Earth Café  7 Hanlin Tea  8 Puppy bobar  9 Keep it  10 Wondertea  11 Enter the Café  12 Urban Ritual  13 Tpumps  14 The Ramen Bar  15 Eightea  16 Super Cue  17 Bliss Sweet  18 Enter the Café  19 BB Tea Station  20 Steap (not Steep)  21 Bubblecup  22 Tea Hut  23 Sharetea  24 Tanca  25 Boba Guys  26 Steep (not Steap)  27 Mr. & Mrs. Tea House  28 T&T Café  29 Bobo Drinks & Pho  30 Samovar Tea  31 5 sweets  32 TJ Cups  33 Asha Tea House  34 E Tea  35 Kestourine Macarons  36 Little Heaven Deli  37 Maggies Café  38 Belly Good Café & Crepes  39 Tea Bear  40 Sweet Heart Café  41 Honeycreme  42 Elixiria  43 Quickly  44 Plentea  45 Sweethut  46 Mi-tea  47 Ten Ren Tea  48 Wonderful Foods/Dessert & Café  49 Out the Door  50 I Café  51 Phusion                                                    
Just a little taste of my greater Bay Area Tiers is below (there are 6 tiers I have in total, I've reviewed over 112 + boba spots now but obviously not enough room to list them all here) 

119 boba spots and counting in the Bay Area (yes you read that correctly one hundred and nineteen...) 

Rod's SF Bay Area Boba Tiers: This is based on my milk tea taste/ boba taste rating scale with 10/10 being the absolute best.  I have actual ranked lists for the South 880 corridor and San Francisco in case you're wondering. 

Tier 1 (Alphabetized) "Magnificent 4" aka" I'll get some even if I shouldn't..."
Bubbly, I-Tea, Pekoe, Teatop

Tier 2 : (Alphabetized) "The Almost Elite..but not quite" aka " I'm a fan but not a die hard" 
Caffe Central, Cool Tea, Factory Tea Bar, Good Earth Café,  Gong Cha, Hanlin Tea, Little Sweet, Passion  T snacks and Dessets Puppy Bobar, Soyful Desserts,  Tea Station ,The Boba Shop, U Cha 

Tier 3 (Alphabetized)  "The Above average spots" aka " Sure why not..let's roll" : 85 Degree, BlackBall Desserts, Bliss Sweet, Bobapia, Cha Express, Che-Lo, Keep it, Puppy Bobar Super Cue, T4, Tastea, Tata Tea,Tea Breeze,  Tea Island, Tea Six,  Tea Station, Teaspoon, Teatime, The Ramen Bar, T-Lab, Tpumps,Urban Ritual, Wondertea,
author: Rod M.

description:
Good boba place in the sunset

Decor is cute with paintings throughout the store. They have a table and a couple small tables and chairs too. There are also some games you can play as well.

Menu is pretty straightforward and they offer a wide array of flavors.

Types of drinks that stood out to me was they offered iced milk and yogurt drinks too.

Flat price $3.99 for a one size cup(on the larger end) which a decent price for a drink and boba in the city.

Tried the G1 iced milk with boba and also the G3 iced milk with black tea and boba

Enjoyed G1 better because it was more icy. Boba was decently chewy. Also i didn't adjust the sweetness and it was not overly sweet, just right.

Would come back here again if I was in the area
author: Michele G.

description: Pretty convenient location for me just off 19th as I drive north, and I really appreciated the mobile ordering option! My only gripe with this is the NEARLY HOUR LONG WAIT I saw after I paid. Luckily, I parked across the street maybe 15 min after I ordered (and 30 min before the supposed ready time) and my drink was ready! The boba was perfectly soft and chewy, but my taro milk tea tasted super powdery AND watered down. I'd try it again if I really needed bubble tea to-go... but definitely not taro.
author: Christine L.

description:
As UC Davis Aggies, the hubby and I love cows and BB Tea Station have quite the adorable design. It has been a little over two years since our first visit and we were more than ready to determine if this place was the real boba deal.

Parking around the area isn't too tough, considering it is San Francisco, but do keep in mind that all parking is metered so don't forget to bring your coins. The parlor itself is roomy enough with some seating for a hang out and the menu is nicely placed on a wall beside the cashier, making for easy reading. I personally like how they have a poster of their top ten drinks and then a color coded chart where you can choose your milk tea, iced drink, fruit tea, and smoothie. Definitely take your time to look at that!

The hubby wanted to get the honeydew milk tea with grass jelly while I chose one of their popular drinks, the iced milk with grass jelly and boba. The cashier was a very friendly guy who was more than eager to help and provided great service. Prices are incredibly inexpensive, totaling a little under $7 for the both of us. I will have to admit that I do hate the "cash only" policy.

My hubby greatly enjoyed the honeydew milk tea, noting how fresh and smooth it tastes. The fruit flavor blended well with the green tea and the silkiness of the grass jelly added a nice refreshing component. My iced milk was blended together and while it was perfect to have on a hot day, I do wish it was a tad bit sweeter. Thankfully, the boba itself was coated with a delectable honey syrup, so my sweet tooth wasn't too disappointed.

Even after two years, the hubby and I are still happy with BB Tea Station. Perhaps this visit wasn't as perfect as the first one, but good enough that we plan to come back again. 

Come for the cute cows, stay for the drinks!
author: Quyen L.

description:
Good, above-average boba spot. I got the matcha latte with boba. On the menu picture it says it come with boba but it actually doesn't, the cahsier told me you have to pay extra for it. That's kind of misleading to most customers in my opinion. 

The fish tank is empty and there's boxes in the back. The decor looks like this place is not finish on construction yet. 

Other than that, solid boba. 3.5 stars.
author: U L.

description:
I like this place! They use REAL taro instead of that powdered stuff. I ordered the lychee yogurt with taro. Lol so I didn't really try the boba itself but I'm sure it's standard stuff

Approved
author: Christina M.

description:
With a huge color coded menu available, I have picked a new drink combination each time I visit. If you get overwhelmed with having too many choices, there is a Top 10 Drinks list available. From that list, I am a fan of the BB Iced Milk with boba and pudding; and mango snow ice with boba.

Bubble milk tea with black tea base is my go-to category. I vary the flavor, such as adding lavender, peach, passion fruit, or mango.

Seating is limited. There are a few board games available (Connect 4, Jenga, etc). I absolutely love the paintings of the BB Tea Station mascot that are inside the shop. They are very cute and adorable.
author: Katie C.

description: Today I came back to brand new furniture at BB tea!! I've been coming here for the past two summers while I visit, and I've loved the tea but today I got the usual matcha milk tea and found that the tapioca pearls were much...chewier than usual? They were hard and felt undercooked which put a damper on my tea, especially considering how you pay extra for toppings. The upgrade in tables and chairs was very nice to come back to, but the consistency in making teas should be fixed because it was frustrating expecting my normal order and getting something that was less-than-pleasant. I'll still go back since I've only had this problem once; BB Tea is in a convenient location. Hopefully they see this and work for consistency!!
author: Macy L.

description: Decided to come back here for a drink. I wanted something cheap, so I ordered the Original Milk Tea(no boba). It tasted funny. It was too sweet and too milky. Not enough tea flavor. The guy asked me about stamp card and I realized I had one and had been neglecting it sometimes. I am 2 drinks away from a free one..but then I did the math and felt like spending another $8-10 for the golden free one was maybe not worth it.
author: Denise C.

description:
I've passed by this boba shop many times, but never stopped by until now. I wanted to like this place, but unfortunately it just did not live up to my boba standards. With so many boba stores in SF, BB Tea Station just doesn't stand up. 

I went with the standard black milk tea. I found the drink to be diluted and the flavor to be quite lacking. I rather drive down to Irving and get my boba fix there instead. 

On the positive, there is a pretty big seating area and they even offer some board games. So I can see this as a nice place to chill and hang out with friends. Unfortunately, the quality of the drinks were a disappointment for me. 

Also this place is CASH ONLY.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Ordered a honey milk tea with lychee jelly. The drink was delicious and not too sweet and not too icy just the way I like it. The drinks also came out really quickly. Didn't think much of the place before because it looks like any other boba place, but the drinks were pretty good. Definitely prefer this place than TJ's a few blocks down. 

However, I dislike that they changed the set up inside. It used to be more cozier and more inviting. They used to have a ton of board games too, but it looks a bit bleak now.
author: Edmund L.

description:
VERY GOOD BOBA!! 
Not Americanized. 
Good price. 
Nice and very unique interior. 
Boba/pearls/tapioca is not hard (its good) 
Stamp cards are available there. 

10/10 recommended
author: Kayla L.

description: Matcha milk tea with boba, not bad. Not too sweet and in a large decent size cup for the price you pay. I visited BB tea station around 2pm, there was only one worker doing both cashier and making drinks. My order took a little long because of that, but overall I'd come back.
author: Christie M.

description:
Averaging $3+ for each cup of boba tea is pretty good in this city, especially since their one size is a large size at other locations. Make sure to ask for their stamp card, as they don't readily offer, but have a small sign posted about it. It would be more convenient if they could go digital with their stamp card! I'm not likely to remember to bring the physical stamp card, but I would definitely have my phone!

I've had their milk tea and their ice milk. Both drinks are slightly watered down. You can ask for light ice, but even then the drink is still diluted. If you don't enjoy super sweet drinks, make sure you take the sweetness down to 75%. 

The interior is small but bright. There are 3-4 small to medium sized tables, and they have free wifi and games. It's a nice spot to chill with friends, but gets awfully loud when it is filled. This would not be a place to stay and study! Street parking is available, though not in abundance. Cash only as well. Maybe I'd stop by if I'm really craving boba tea after dining at Cafe Bakery across the street. Otherwise, I wouldn't come out of my way for their drinks.
author: Kristi T.

description:
one of the better mango green tea that I had for the past few months. it does not taste like it was made with powder. 

the tea is not too sweet and tasted just right.

on a rainy Monday there were no lines 8 pm. 

I will be back for more.
author: Wai C.

description:
BB Tea isn't the best boba shop in town by any stretch, but it's certainly passable, so if you're seeking a quiet place to laptop camp when writing Yelp reviews, it should fit the bill. In this part of town, TFM closes a tad too early, and Super Cue doesn't really have any comfortable seating, so BB Tea fills this void. The decor is a bit strange, although according to some previous reviews, apparently there initially was more elaborate theming. I wonder what caused the change.

Of the times I have visited, it has never been busy. As a matter of fact, on a recent Saturday evening in August, many of the latenight establishments along Noriega, including Golden Island a few doors down, were packed to the rafters, but the staff at BB Tea was more busy swatting flies (a Chinese phrase to indicate a lack of business). I was pretty much the only customer in the entire store from 10 pm to midnight. However, if they can manage to stay afloat, this certainly works for me!

As far as the drinks go, I'd say it is in the middle of the pack for SF. It's not quite at Little Sweet status, but is more favorable to a place like Teaspoon. I surely wouldn't drop by BB Tea just for their offerings, but as mentioned, it makes for a great study spot.

One oddity is that the high chairs seem a bit too tall for the small tables, to the point where even a manlet like me is forced to hunch over slightly. In quick spurts, this is perfectly fine, but over a prolonged period, it may not be the most ergonomic. Just be quick and succinct when drafting those Yelp reviews, and you should be perfectly fine!
author: Eric W.

description:
I've always gotten friendly service here and I often order online before picking up . So i never have an issue here . You may have to wait a few minutes because they finish making the drink when you're in the store to pick up . That's fine with me because the ice in the drinks won't be melting away before hand.

I normally order the almond milk tea with pudding. The slight almond flavor with milk tea works out and I enjoy the pudding more than chewing and spitting out boba balls. 

The lemon tea with fruit jelly is also a refreshing drink to have. The lemon tea here reminds me of a less sweet vita lemon tea drink. 

Always tempted to get something here weekly ... maybe I'll get a ice milled drink next or a snow ice drink or some yogurt drink hmmmm
author: Myron L.

description:
SURPRISINGLY good. Do not let decor fool ya. The staff is friendly and the drinks are decently priced.

Gotta admit, the menu is a little confusing. I didn't quite get what was going on.. and I get it. They're trying to keep it simple, but trust me, it's not simple til you get how it works. Drinks were made quick, and you can adjust sweetness which is always a plus (Hate those spots who don't let you adjust sweetness). 

Definitely would keep this place in mind if I'm in the area.
author: Deanna G.

description: I think this is my favorite bubble tea place so far in the Bay Area. The staff are very polite and professional and the place is quiet. Perfect for studying or reading. They have very cute cow wall paintings, chairs and decorations in the store. Though I recommend ordering 25% sweet (I don't have a sweet tooth but I usually order 50-75%) for this place as they tend to be on the sweeter side. Their bubble milk tea is a must-try. I ordered it with grass jelly and pudding and its perfect.
author: Kalin M.

description:
An A-OK Place, decent taste, just nothing major. However, you should try the place out atleast for a first timer try. 
Disclaimer: i gave it a 2 star rating based on the drink i had, maybe next time, i'll get a drink that will change my mind.
author: Stacey M.

description:
I love boba so much, my mission is to try every boba place in San Francisco. I saw somewhere on BB Tea reviews that their g5 was a dupe for one of Purple Kow drink. I absolutely love boba and haven't able to get my hands on Purple Kow yet. So, I came here on a late night craving. 

The place only takes cash however, you can order through yelp/eat24 and pay through your credit card I think. Near by seemed really crowded but, it was pretty empty inside. I absolutely loved the paintings, evetything was so cute! Anyways,  the g5 was pretty good, just wish there was more caramel in it. I love the pudding and boba! I didn't really taste any tea but that's fine, I'm not one to really care for a strong tea flavor in my milk tea. 

Overall, really yummy milk tea experience. Definitely will come again.
author: Ann N.

description: Great milk tea place w/nice painted walls! Nice and quiet area to study and finish some work at. Also, there are great staffs. ;)
author: Qi Qi H.

description: The drinks here are pretty delicious I usually order the milk drink with boba and I love how they use fresh milk! My friend really enjoys the ginger milk tea i tried a few sips and it's really good if you enjoy ginger! The staff is not the friendliest they seem to want you to order and leave. And the atmosphere feels dirty and old. It's like they don't have a theme it's completely random. However the drinks are good but I wouldn't sit in the store!
author: Carissa C.

description: Just went yesterday with a friend. The milk tea iced was good with tapioca. I ended up getting the hot honey jujube milk tea with tapioca. Literally so good. ($3.40+$0.50 for tapioca) was filling enough. Would come back occasionally.
author: Wesley K.

description:
Decent boba place in outer sunset. Sitting area is kinda small, but there are games to play and it stays open late. 

Milk Tea is average, but prices are decent. I think the milk tea itself is a little watered down, but the flavoring (such as coconut, rose, etc) are good. 

staff was very friendly and efficient. Although mediocre drinks, a great place to hang out for some boba!
author: Karen C.

description: The tea is fine. I'm not an expert on boba tea; I've had better, but it's fine. What is unacceptable is how dirty it is inside. There are only about 4 tables in the place. It looks like it hasn't been cleaned in months. The floor is dirty, there is a filthy (and empty) fish tank in the front, the window seats are full of dirt and dead bugs. I obviously cannot comment on the back, but come on college kids, clean the table area. It's almost never busy either. They also have board games, which would be nice if any of them weren't completely destroyed and also dirty.
author: Ashley F.

description:
Sweet college student cashier.  Nice owner who made me a milk tea to order--25% sweetness.  You can always add more sugar later, but CAN'T take it away after the fact.  Good practical approach--my kind of guy‼

A few too many fruit flies hovering in cool corners of the shop for my taste, but I can ignore that because of the nice people. It's much harder for me to ignore the loud commentary from young Chinese student crowds.  Pregnancy has given me an extra  boost to my already sensitive hearing.
author: Marie H.

description:
Wicked atmosphere
Killer radio
Sweet tea
Awesome game selection
The only reason I am giving bb tea 4 stars is because they don't have their pieces to connect 4
Y'all are still tight tho
Amen
author: Brad W.

description:
This is my go to spot since I live close to it, I usually come here when I don't want to walk the extra 5 blocks to go to itea which I prefer.  The staff here is always nice and very accommodating which is mostly the reason why I'm giving it 4 stars.  I've been here countless times and one thing I do like is the choice between green and black tea also their boba is usually cooked very well.  I've tried pretty much everything from the milk teas to the flavored teas and the slushies,  my personal favorite is The passion fuit green iced tea with boba.

Don't expect to get the boba of your life, however it's definitely good and the fact they don't have a huge line is definitely a plus.

It is also nice that they have a stamp card and you get your 10th boba free :)
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
MOST DILUTED MILK TEA. EVER. THE ABSOLUTE WORST. 

Every time I've ordered taro milk tea from here, my drink had absolutely NO flavor at all. NONE. I've also tried some of my friends drinks that they've ordered, and they were WAY too watered down. Such a disappointment. 

I just don't see how this place gets a 4 star rating with such watered down drinks. Seriously.
author: Amanda R.

description: Love their drinks...  Highly recommend.... The servers are very friendly and the store inside is very nice. I love their oolong milk tea my favor.
author: Ray R.

description:
The texture of their boba is usually pretty good, but their tea drinks almost always taste watered down. I've found that my favorite options are the fruity yogurt drinks - mango and lychee are both pretty good! 

Overall, a fine option in a pinch - but they really have to work on their drink mixes to improve the flavor!
author: Delia Z.

description:
CASH ONLY!

I've tried both mango and passion black milk tea w/ boba and both are pretty good. The only complaint I have is the service. My first time here, I had a defective lid and the straw wouldnt budge through. Every time I jabbed it in, some of the drink would come up, making it impossible to poke in. I was obviously struggling at the counter and the worker (literally a foot away), was just watching me and putting stickers on the cups.. FINALLY a guy (I'm assuming the manager) came up from behind and offered to re-seal my drink and everything was fun.

One upside is that their boba is fresh & they have lots of games/cards out in the open you're able to play with your friends while you're there!
author: Carrie L.

description:
2.6 for watered down milk tea. Must give credit to their QQ boba. Must say, cooked better than Purple Kow's, the other day.

Don't think I would return--
author: Jana C.

description:
Another Boba place in SF? Of course I would come.

Typical SF parking is the main thing you will have to deal with. Just park a few blocks away and walk. It will be worth it.

If you are around the area, I do suggest you come to BB Tea Station. They have A LOT of drink options and it's pretty consistent. I got the Strawberry Green tea with jelly and it was very refreshing. (my go to drink)

The following time I decided to be more adventurous (lol) and I tried the Matcha Milk Tea with Boba. The pearls were on the chewy/tougher side, but it's okay... I dealt with it. Anywho, I thought the matcha milk tea was pretty good (even though I tasted the powder), but good nonetheless. It is one of their top 10 drinks.

Overall... I would definitely come back
author: Martin N.

description:
Good boba, decent tea.

Drink sizes are automatically large.  Jasmine green milk tea with boba ($3.40 + $.50) - good boba texture, slightly sweet boba, and good jasmine flavor/aroma.  They tend to skimp on the boba, so I usually have half my drink left, and no boba.

Almond black milk tea with boba (same price as above) - hubby loved it, and even craved it the next day (and he is not one to have boba cravings)!  I think they use real almonds (grittier almond milk), which he liked.  I prefer smooth and fake to real/organic, but, hey, to each their own.

PASS on egg pudding and grass jelly--they tend to overcook so the edges have the bad bubbly texture, like jello that's been in the fridge too long.

Metered parking outside, but you can quickly double park and not block traffic if you're just there to pick up.

TIP: order online (where you can pay with credit card) or over the phone to have your drink ready when you arrive.  If you don't order online, it's CASH only.

For my favorite boba in the city, go to T4. :)
author: Vanessa O.

description:
Bb tea station is definitely an underrated boba spot here in the sunset... With more well known places like tpumps, teaway, and supercue, it's hard to compete, but bb tea station makes consistently good drinks and has so many other options!

Bb has milk tea, snow ice, iced milk, yogurt, latteas, flavored tea, and even coffee! I like the fact that they have a lot of different flavors to choose from; I especially like the fruity ones! The menu looks complicated at first, but just know that the dots next to the fruit flavors in the rows going down correspond to which flavors you can get for the drinks on the top columns.

I usually get peach green milk tea with boba, or passion green milk tea with boba! The drinks here always have the perfect amount of sweetness, and the boba is perfectly chewy! The iced milk drink with caramel, pudding, and boba is also reallly good! My bf really likes the taro black milk tea here (even though it's a weirdish color, lol). 

Bb is pretty quiet and whenever i've come it's relatively empty. The place is really cute though, they have small tables and in the back they have a few board games you can play while you wait for your drink or after you get your drink. The employees are usually pretty nice, and the drinks come out relatively fast! I'll be back!

Also FYI.. Cash only!!!!!
author: Tara A.

description:
I ordered 5 drinks for my family and I via DoorDash. I ordered 2 honeydew milk teas with boba, 1 taro milk tea with boba, 1 caramel flavored milk tea with boba, and 1 iced milk w/ caramel, pudding, and boba.

All of the drinks were filled to the top except for the caramel one! It was literally only 60% full. I'm not sure why all of them were fine except for that one. We checked the bag to see if some had spilled while in transit, but there was no evidence of it being spilled. Nonetheless, my brother drank it anyway.

The best part of the drinks was the boba, which had a nice chewy consistency. But overall, not the best boba drinks in the city. I won't be ordering from here again.
author: Fallon P.

description:
This is a small little Bubble Tea spot in the Outer Sunset. They have a great selection of drinks and the service is fast. I wouldn't say there's anything that makes this place stand out, but it's by no means something you should pass up if you're in the area.

If I had to make any sort of constructive criticism, it would be to go lighter on the sugar. I actually told them to do 50% of the regular sugar they'd use, and it was still a bit too much. Also, make sure you have cash with you as they don't take any cards.

Pros: 3 stars 
+drink selection 
+prices 
+nice staff

Cons: -2 stars 
+a bit too sugary/watered down 
+cash only 
+pretty average milk tea
author: Alex B.

description:
Their drinks are a bit watered down every time I come. Meh. This time, I ordered a matcha green milk tea! No toppings cause their boba wasn't ready to be served (ugh what is life without boba...). I barely tasted the matcha in the drink and it was like a smoothie. It was kind of like Starbucks green tea frappe but less sweet, less matcha, and a bit more tea taste. It's only one size but it's like a large compared to other boba places! 

Pricewise, it's average; $4.25 for my matcha green tea with no toppings. BTW, cash only.
author: Eva C.

description:
I always get the peach milk tea with pudding along with the honeydew milk tea with boba. It's really good! Not too sweet, not bitter, just right!
Me and my boyfriend go here whenever we have time, since we like to play our game of connect four, or uno, which is provided by the store.
The store is clean, and has a place to sit down to rest, unlike most boba stores.
Good place to hang!
author: Aya H.

description:
This boba place is near my house and my sister really likes how convenient it is. There is not much of a wait compared to other places in the area and it has a simple clean decor.  The boba was pretty average. Nothing too memorable and nothing super offensive. The cost was reasonable. 

I got the lavender milk tea and I thought it was sweet. My mom thought it taste artificial. The boba here isn't honey boba so if you are used to that now (I have been spoiled) then you might be a bit disappointed. However the texture is on point and the menu has a lot of options.  

If you are in the area and craving boba then I would recommend trying this place but it is a very typical solid boba place.
author: Jocelyn K.

description: Good , Friendly , Energetic Staff . I Believe it's Family,  Owned and Operated . Good Variety of  Asian Type Milk Teas and Others Along With a Variety of Toppings and Additional Additives . Yogurt Blends are My Favorite . Prices are Fair  . And the Lychee Jelly is Really Good . Support the Local College Girls Here
author: Gerry L.

description: This was the closest boba to dinner a couple weeks ago, so we went. Average at best. There are a million and one other boba shops in the city, so granted, competition is fierce. That being said, I wouldn't go back here unless I was in a pinch.
author: Lauren C.

description:
I've had milk tea with boba downtown at a cafe of a parking garage and wanted to find a boba place in my neighborhood.  This place was rated to be one of the top two places so off we went.  Then everything went downhill from there.

*we had to wait 10 minutes while they make the boba
(That's not bad...but)

*they got the order wrong twice
 (Boba milk tea with topping)

*tea was weak and did not taste good.... weak weak weak! It was milk water with tea coloring!

*to top it off the service was smirky and she was condescending- never apologized and when she was in the wrong and I tried to explain what I had wanted- she turned up the moody - I'm a student and don't care what you say attitude.

Downtown garage cafe boba much better than this cutesy place....  get much better service too downtown.
author: A. Marie L.

description:
TL;DR?? Average mediocre milk tea boba shop. Ambiance is simple, clean interior. Parking is limited on the streets. Prices are average as well - $3.40+ for 20 oz. boba sizes.

BB Tea Station is Sharetea and Quickly's mildly amusing cousin who wears neutral colors and stays put in one seat throughout the whole Thanksgiving dinner, while Sharetea is the sophisticated, charismatic cousin and Quickly's is the cheap, hustler wild child. 

I ordered the regular Pearl Milk Tea to judge on their baseline and it was mediocre. The milk tea was moreso watery and not as strong or flavorful in their tea component. My friend ordered the Green Milk Tea and had similar reserves as I did. The boba pearls were disintegrating in my cup-- that was unappealing. Pearls were slightly hard possibly due to it being an old batch.

I appreciate their vast array of menu choices and clean tables/chairs. They also have a stamp card but I doubt I'll be back unless I am in the neighborhood. The baby and cow mascot also weirds me out. Weirddd.
author: Donna T.

description:
I just found out that consuming balls can cause cancer?  Balls in boba, so don't freak out too much ladies and gents!  Hehehe..  But anyways, even though the boba here had the perfect consistency and a light honey taste, I may be refraining from ordering it when I get an icy/tea/yogurt drink, etc.  I've been wanting to try BB Tea Station for awhile after seeing it so much whenever I eat nearby.  

I got the pineapple icy which was refreshing and not overly sweet.  BB Tea Station is a little on the pricier side if you compare it to Super Cue, Teaway, T-Pumps and Ocha.  The menu can be a little difficult to follow.  3.5 stars for now, but rounding a little down since I liked Super Cue more...there adorable cow logo though..it gets to me!
author: Cat C.

description: Visiting the tiles stairs nearby and got a craving for boba milk tea. Found this place and made our way over here. I got my standard order: Thai milk tea with boba. Not as sweet as I'm used to, but much better for my teeth. They have a ton of flavors and toppings you can get. If I was feeling more adventurous, I'd probably try some of them. The lady ringing us up asked if we had a card but I told her we were just visiting. Cute place, loved the design of their logo. They also had games in the back, which a group of friends were playing Uno.
author: Haneen O.

description: Got an Iced Milk w/ Pudding last Friday. Person that was working was name Kathy. Very cheerful. We've been going here for years & love it!
author: Kenny C.

description:
Their branded sticker on their cups, is what drew me in to check out this baobei (baby) boba shop on a thirsty, boba craving day!  You must admit that the cartoon image of the cow and a baby is adorable!

Their colorful menu is all over the place.  It took me awhile to straighten out what the options are and to look over what they have to offer!  They have a good variety, but please fix the menu so it isn't all so confusing!

I ordered up their Green Milk Tea with boba, 0% sugar and coconut flavor.  It was good!  Do skip their Pomegranate fruit milk tea drink!  It looks like Pepto Bismol color and it didn't taste like pomegranate juice.  It was more of a substitute flavor.

They offer up side snacks, provide board games to play with and showcase music videos on a flat screen TV.  They do the stamp card as well.

I would come back to get my BB fix!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
-Mediocre milk tea. I think they use milk powders because you can see the powder residue in your cup. I think it's a a bit too watery too.
-Boba is NOT FRESH AT ALL. It's HARD. I don't think they make fresh boba daily.
-They leave their straws UNCOVERED and UNWRAPPED in a jar out there in the open. So basically, someone reaching for a straw can sneeze on them and contaminate the entire straws! Other shops have individually wrapped straws nowadays...
author: Vicki L.

description: Lots of drink options here! Parking isn't that bad, there are plenty of spots around the area if you take the time to look for parking. Drinks are very tasty here. My go-to is always peach green tea with lychee jelly. Workers are usually nice and welcoming as well!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Idk, I've tried so many boba joints that everything is starting to taste the same for me.

Just kidding.
This used to be that snowflake place (was it called snowflake? Hell I don't recall). Now it's a tiny joint on Noriega that serves milk tea, green/black tea, lattea(tea creams), iced milk, iced coffees, warm drinks, snacks, and smoothies. It's a small establishment, but I love how simple it looks. A few tables with really cute and long-legged green chairs. The menu surosingly extends in a vertical manner next to the cash register... And its the cutest menu I've seen up to date. 

Tried their matcha lattea here (It's like a tea cream... And I always try tea creams first now heh) at first I was strangely perplexed, because it was so thick on top that I thought I was drinking cream alone. But then a few more sips in, I got the matcha. Yes! It tastes like... Matcha. I suggest just stirring it, lest you like the cream first before anything.

I've only been here twice, but this place, as quiet and quaint as it is, seems to draw me in for more.

Overall:
Lattea: 4/5 
Milk teas: 3.5/5
Parking: a big FCUK YOU. Lol jk, biggest hit or miss in the evening. Maybe more luck in the day?

Cash only. They have jenga while you sit. JENGA.
author: Jerianne G.

description:
I came here with some friends after our late dinner since BB Tea was across the street and we wanted some boba. Like most places, this is a pretty small boba shop with cute decors. I'm definitely a sucker for cute space and I love that they painted their ceilings (haha). 

Anyways, I decided to try something new and got a Lavender Milk Tea because why not. I got my drink pretty quickly, but sadly, I didn't really taste much of the lavender. I guess they didn't want to use too much or else it could be overpowering. But to me, it just tasted like a regular milk tea. My friend said he could taste a little bit of the lavender but I couldn't. I guess they're new and are still trying to figure things out so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and hope that they'll improve. 

Overall, it's a decent place for a quick boba drink if you just want something simple.
author: Wendy Y.

description: I was skeptical with the iced milk drink at first but ordered it anyway since it's something different. Got it with the caramel, egg pudding & Boba. It was super delish! The Boba has the perfect texture & sweetness. The grass jelly that I ordered with my kumquat green tea is pretty good too. There was no line when we got there on Sunday 1pm. We ordered ours online for pick up through yelp/eat24 & you can pay with credit card (it's cash only in store). It was done when we got there (within 5min of ordering).
author: Elizabeth N.

description: It's taken us a long time to give this place a try given we live only a few blocks away, but it is solid.  Not the best, but far better than the worst (Quickly).  Kids are big fans of the G5 (caramel milk tea with boba and pudding) and I enjoy their mango yogurt smoothie.  Drawbacks are that it is cash only and that all toppings (like boba) are extra, which doesn't seem to make sense, but that's why it's a drawback.  We don't hesitate to stop by here when we have cash and need a quick boba fix.
author: lucy w.

description:
Just popped in here a couple of nights ago. Great to see that it was open late! There were still several groups of friends hanging around, sipping on drinks and playing with the board games BB Tea provides. 

I went with the original flavored bubble milk tea. Was pretty good! Even my sister who says she doesn't normally like milk tea was enjoying this one. It came with a heaping of boba and the drink had the perfect level of sweetness. Prices were standard.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Before coming here I read the reviews & was prepared to be disappointed. No boba for me & light sweet.

I got the iced milk drink without boba with grass jelly & light sweet. I had to shake it up real good & stir it before poking my straw into it. Obviously, it tasted like milk. I guess I was expecting more from it. 

My boyfriend got yogurt lychee green tea with aloe vera. The yogurt tasted like yogurt from Asia. I love eating Asia yogurt, but I don't know if I like drinking Asia yogurt with a mix of green tea. 

BB Tea Station has cute decorations, cute logo & weird chairs. 

They also have a stamp card.

CASH ONLY
author: Kathleen U.

description:
Girl got my order wrong twice... 

I asked for basic bubble milk green tea since I've never tried this place before. She asked me if I wanted any toppings and I'm like, "uhhh boba (bubble part of the order?!)" I got charged for boba as an individual topping as well. 

I received a green tea crema with boba. I almost thought that was their version of the milk tea but asked just in case. She was like, you ordered that...? Then re-took my order and told me I owe her another 65 cents for the milk. She also struggled with the register at this point so maybe she's new?? 

When my order came out, it was wrong again! This time, she wrote on my cup "black milk tea boba". At this point, I'm just like fuck it I'll just take it. Only to be disappointed further more. The taste was so bland. Very little tea taste. However, the boba had a good consistency. 

My friend said that the mango slush was good at least but this place is pricy. My basic bubble milk tea came out to be $4.30. 

I like that this place has decent seating though. I just wish the cashier would check the order if they couldn't comprehend it the first time around...
author: Jannet H.

description:
12/10 about 11:15pm
Wow! Talking about interesting service. Walked in. No one to be seen. You have to push a button for service. Then 2 guys came out. They kept talking to one another the whole time I was there. Order lychee green tea with boba. Did not taste like lychee at all. Disappointed...
+1 on their wall art
author: Jasmin T.

description:
Location is convenient but the drinks are nothing to rave about. I usually order the jasmine milk tea with boba or grass jelly. There's always a hint of soap taste in my drinks. I'm not sure if it the lack of rinsing on their part or it's the flavor of the tea. It could just be me. 

The staff are nice, there is ample seating, and location is good. That's where the three stars are earned.
author: Winnie L.

description:
This was a very mediocre drink experience. I walked in and the menu was confusing af. Like there were a few prices listed on the top of the menu, specifying the price differences between a milk tea or an iced blended one. And then there was a huge list of just fruity flavors. I picked out two and apparently you can only pick one. I was a little annoyed because I don't like committing to one flavor; I like to mix things up to my liking. 

I gave up on deciding a fruity flavor so I just opted for a classic boba milk tea with green tea. It straight up tasted like a cheap Quickly's drink, but watered down. It was a weird color too, kind of pink. The boba was meh and was kind of soggy. 

Don't go here. Go to Share Tea.
author: Stephanie K.

description: The iced milk with black tea wasn't strong enough for my tastes, but what can you expect when it's mostly milk and good yummy milk like it's supposed to be? The boba is too chewy for my liking too, but everyone has their own preferences! I thought the logo is pretty cute! The prices are really good; around 3-4 bucks for a regular milk tea is hella worth it!
author: Tina R.

description:
I got the lychee green milk tea with boba at 50% sweet. (It was on the top ten list)  It was ok, and still sweeter than what I would call 50%. But the boba was nice ans soft, but not really sweet on its own, so I think that's why the tea is more sweet. I felt like I could taste more milk and lychee flavor more than I could taste the tea. I usually like more tea flavor than anything else in my boba drinks. 
Overall a cute place and really friendly staff. Not that much of a fan, so i wouldn't go out of my way to try other flavors.
author: Jenn H.

description: If there's one thing that's great about BB, it's that they've got multiple non-caffeinated option, including their fantastic iced milk option, which, after sipping on for a few minutes, is just frozen diluted milk, so it's not so good anymore. However, I'm a huge fan of their pudding. Unlike places like Quickly, Tpumps, or Onyx, their pudding isn't just left on a refrigerated shelf. It's not on Purple Kow or iTea's level, but it's a decent substitute. This place is cash only and tiny. There isn't a lot of room to work, but the wifi is decent, and they have a bathroom. It's actually one of the decent boba places that stay open until 10pm. You can get flavored tea, milk tea, a slush, whatever. Just don't expect iTea-quality tea and actual ingredients. There's a reason why they can make everything so quickly.
author: Danny C.

description:
This was easy to order and very simple and delicious!

Thanks for making me a happy Jew!!
author: David F.

description:
**CASH ONLY**

Becoming one of my favorite bubble tea places. 
Great selection of flavors/options - both the fruit based and milk based teas are good. Prices are slightly cheaper/ on par with other boba places.

You can customize the sugar levels and ice levels. The boba is made perfectly - the regular milk tea does not disappoint. 

I haven't tried their snow ice/ ice milk teas yet - but apparently this is one of their signature items. Shaved milk ice with toppings is probably how it's best described.

They have a few small tables inside along with some board games as well. Don't forget to get your stamp card - buy 9 get 1 free.
author: Brenda L.

description: Watery drinks. Lack of tea flavor.  Confusing menu and two out of three choices were out or no longer available (then please remove it from menu).  Hard boba.  Lack of customer service. Dark ambience. Dirty table.
author: Janita s.

description: Love this place so much!!! G5 is the best milk tea ever, me and my boyfriend always order it. And their yogurt drink is pretty good too.
author: Angelala L.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to get boba milk tea in SF. They use real milk and blend their drinks well, unlike other places where there's still powder to be found. The taste is as clean as their decor. 

Even though the service and wait time is pretty slow, the wait is more pleasant as it is clean. I can forgive the wait as my drinks are prepared just right every time. Tapiocas are soft and chewy. 

Menu was a bit complicated at first because of all it's offerings. So far nothing has disappoint. My favorites are the honeydew and almond black milk tea. 

Don't forget to pick up a stamp card!
author: Stan L.

description:
BB Tea Station has everything I could ever want in a boba (refusing to call it bubble tea) place. There is plenty of seating and even BOARD GAMES so hang out with a few of your friends here. I would recommend going somewhere else for larger groups. I believe there is also free WiFi so you can get some work done while enjoy delicious boba.

At first the menu confused me because it took my eyes awhile to adjust to the grid. Then I realized... WOW! They have so many flavors that can be made in so many different ways. I settled on Apple Green Milk Tea with Boba ($3.70) which was delicious. Service is quick, drinks are cheap, the amount of ice in the drinks is minimal, and the sizes are huge. The only downside is the cash-only policy, but if you're walking around the Sunset district, you should already be used to that.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
BB Tea Station over T-Pumps!

My go to drink is either lavender green milk tea, matcha green milk tea or almond green milk tea. My friend loves their chocolate black milk tea and caramel black milk tea. Their staff is super friendly and would be glad to recommend favors to you. Only down side is their drink trays, they only fit two cups a time and if you're like me and get paranoid, if you're not holding it, you'll fear that it will tilt in your car and your drink went to waste. But that doesn't stop me from coming here!
author: Eva O.

description:
Hot Lavender milk green tea was superb! I have been to so many tea places in the area and this is one of them that really specializes in herbal/ infused tea. They have lots of options. Service was quick and friendly. Plus, there were no long crazy lines like the one you would find in Tpump or Purple Cow. 

I used to like Quickly (see how ive upgraded?) until i realized that it was starting to give me stomach upset. I switched to Tpump/Purple cow but the quality was no comparison to others like this one. After drinking Tpump for awhile, i would get a stomach upset from the acidity in it (not sure why). 

So far Bbtea, Teaway, and Craftea are my favorites!
author: Pinky A.

description:
- Milk tea tasted kinda watered down?
+ Free Wi-Fi!
+ They have a small board game section in the back
- I think it was cash only if I remember correctly

I only wanted to try this place for the sake of trying it. I doubt I would go back unless I'm in the area, but I'd rather drive down to Irving and get better boba at Wonderful or T-Pumps.
author: Marjo M.

description:
This place has A WHOLE WHOLE WHOLE LOTTA options...

menu is a bit weird to read but once you get it, its pretty cool

I got the regular black milk tea with boba the first time and honey black milk tea with boba the second time.  Both times no complaints but it's nothing really worth WOWing me to come back daily....

The boba is great, has a nice chew and it's sweet.  

Cash only and no reward systems...boo
author: Laurie W.

description:
Saw BB Tea after eating at cafe bakery and decided to grab a drink. Looking over the top 10 just got me more confused on what to order.  I asked the cashier what her favorite milk tea drink was and she did it was lavender milk tea with puddings. 

I think of lavender as being really floral and something in air fresheners, but I didn't want to think about it and went with her recommendation. It was perfect. There was not an over abundance of lavender and just an overall good drink. Thanks for the recommendation to the cashier!!!  

Looking forward to trying other drinks when I'm in the area.
author: G M.

description: This is a local spot that I noticed some time ago and considering I love milk tea and all things tea related I finally found time to stop in today. The menu is on point with all the options...THIS GUY RIGHT HERE LOVES OPTIONS, UHUH! I ordered a black milk tea with boba and was not disappointed. The ordered was prepared in less that 5 minutes which is excellent time. Enjoyed my beverage here with the lady. I was looking for Thai ice tea as well but I did not see it on the menu. If they do have Thai ice tea and I missed it then they place will receive a 5  star rating but if they do not then they 4 stars is simply due to their lack of. Chill spot overall. I will most likely be back again.
author: Robert F.

description: Cute place though it's kind of lacking in lighting at night so the games and ample space doing get used. The boba is acceptable to good. You get tons of selection on the drink itself. For yogurt tea lovers, be warned, their yogurt drink is actually kind of a smoothie, not your usual TW fair, but it's still good.
author: Joy Y.

description: Delicious is what I have to say!!!  We had the Strawberry green tea and Yogurt raspberry drink.  Great selection of flavors to choose from.   Friendly and very helpful staff.  College kids making super yummy drinks... love the logo!!!  Wish you were down in Orange County!!!
author: Lanya S.

description:
I commend the night shift crew for their balanced portion sizes of tea, boba, and ice. The day shift made a regular black tea for my friend that was 2/3 filled with cubed ice. Also, the night shift are very energetic and easy to get along with. When they asked me how the kumquat flavor tasted like, I said "It tastes like something you'd put on your face (make-up,lotion)." Afterwards, they laughed and said they'd like to make one for themselves.  

I really love the sweetness of their boba and their large selection of flavors! I have tried a majority of them, including kumquat, passion fruit, papaya, matcha, and pomegranate. My August 2016 favorite is kumquat for its unique tangy, yet sweet favor, but it's definitely not for everyone. 

Only limitation is that they're a CASH ONLY shop so bring cash in hand!
author: Anne Jolene C.

description:
So I walked like 7 miles through San Francisco (Mission District to the Sunset) with my boyfriend, brother and his girlfriend and we stopped by BB Tea for a refreshing Peach Green Tea and holy shit, that hit the spot! One of my new favorite drinks now because it's SOO refreshing. And if you go here often enough, they memorize your order. :P 

Oh another favorite order of mine is their Iced Milk Drink with caramel, pudding, and boba. YUM! I wish I wasn't at work now.....
author: Stephanie Z.

description: I got the black milk tea boba with ice very good!!!! and its up the block and around the corner from my house! ive always passed by this spot but never went inside so decided to give it a try for the first time! will deff be coming back more!!!! Thank you guys!
author: Bariska Y.

description:
I do not recommend BB Station if you are going to have to make your way out here for boba. 

I got the Matcha Milk Tea with Boba. If you're looking for a drink with more tea flavor and less powder texture, don't come here. When drinking the Matcha Milk Tea, I literally felt like I was drinking liquid and powder... GROSSS. I don't want to come back if it weren't for the great area to play board games and hang out with friends after dinner.
author: Wendy T.

description:
Cash only joint so make sure you have cash.

Drinks are pretty good. I asked and they use real fruit to flavor their tea instead of syrup. There was actual bits of papaya in the milk tea so probably better than the artificial stuff. The Iced milk drink was probably a little on the sweet side. So if you like sweet get the ice milk with caramel, pudding and boba. I drank half and added some regular milk at home and it tasted fine then. The ice milk was interesting and not many places do it so it is something to try.
author: Vincent W.

description: Good tea, fast service, good vibes overall. I come here pretty often, and its a good place to get studying done especially late at night.
author: Kent H.

description:
This is the type of boba you like because it's convenient. 

I like the environment of this boba place because they painted all the walls in a very creative way, and it's nice to look at as you wait for your boba. I came here with a friend, wanting to work on our personal statements. The cashier was very nice and my order came out fairly quickly. I ordered a regular milk tea with egg pudding and boba. They were very generous with the toppings, which is a plus. The milk tea and the boba were sort of bland, but the egg pudding was good. (I've been to this place a couple times before, and they're very inconsistent)

The drinks were overall alright, and I give thanks to the employees for letting my friend and me stay for over 2 hours.
author: Tweety D.

description:
I looooooooove boba! I like to try new places and I was beyond excited to try it out here.  

To start, the menu is super cute, but so confusing! My friend and I had a hard time trying to figure out what was so special about this place and only came to realize it's options are just like quickly or t pumps but more confusing. 

The service was awful. To start the girl took my order and then took about 10 min to make my drink... There was no one else in line except for my friend behind me. Which the girl taking orders didn't realize and was eating RIGHT IN FRONT of my friend standing right in front of the register, for another 15 minutes. 

I had also ordered edamame andddd it took about 25 min for it to come out of the kitchen. 

Needless to say, I won't be going back. 

Oh, and the drink itself was mediocre. On the plus they do have taro chunks and red bean. Otherwise they would get a 1 star.
author: Elysia M.

description:
3.5 stars but I'll round up because the service was quick and pleasant.

I have mixed feelings about this place. I had a lavender black milk tea and was pleased with the flavor. It was very light with the flavor, predominately a black milk tea with just a hint of lavender. The flavor was smooth and light, very refreshing. 

My only disappointment was with the boba. It was too soft and didn't have enough chew that makes a really good boba. Maybe it was just an off night?

However I was pleased enough with the flavor of the milk tea that I would be back to try it one more time (in case it was just an off night)
author: Jenna H.

description: Ok but not in love. Got the green milk tea with grass jelly.  After asking about sweetness levels, I was was advised not to cut the sugar (like I usually would do). So I got it with regular sugar, but it was still a bit bland. Grass jelly had high elasticity which made it hard to drink -- too much gelatin and not enough flavoring. The regular milk tea tasted better.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Cute boba shop with cute stickers of their logo on their cups, but that's really it for me. 

The menu itself is a bit confusing. There's numbers and letters and... why. Iced coffees, iced milk drinks, milk teas, and latteas... what. I wasn't sure what to make of the menu so I just went up to the cashier and ordered a matcha milk tea. HUZZAH. It's a real drink here. And boba is an extra 50 cents. My total for a matcha milk tea with boba = $3.14. The cashier was nice enough. She offered a smile and waited patiently while I got my money. 

I only had to wait a few minutes for my drink so that was fine. But... the drink is not for me. It's WAY too sweet even for me. And believe me. I LOVE sweet things. It's also sort of powder-y. Some sips I take leaves me with gritty teeth.. You know that feeling you get when you grind your teeth a little and it feels like sand is there? Yeah. That feeling.

I don't know. I just don't think this place is for me.
author: Venus L.

description:
Boba drinks here are just ok. I don't really hate it, I don't really love it. I had their chocolate milk tea with grass jelly and it tasted really gritty and kinda powdery. It's probably because they didn't really mix the cocoa powder well into the milk tea. They should've melted the cocoa powder in some hot water first then added it into the milk tea so that the powder can dissolve correctly. But they probably just added the cocoa powder straight into the cold milk tea. 

Tip- they have a stamp card!
author: Janet K.

description: Had the BB iced milk w/ boba and pudding and it was delicious! Right amount of sweetness and milkiness! Definitely recommend this place for yummy boba :)
author: Kotoko T.

description:
I have tried many drinks from this place and they were all very average except One- the Lavender a Black Milk tea!
I was waiting next door to get some dessert and decided to get some milk tea. I first ordered two lavender milk tea and went to Prince Cooking to enjoy my sweets. 30 minutes later, I ordered another two cups. This is how good they taste. Try it and you will love it!
Right now, they are doing a promotion of 15% off all drinks except snacks all the way thru the end of October. Yeah!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Drink I have tried:

-Passion Fruit Yogurt or Lychee Yogurt: MY FAVORITE DRINKS HERE. The fruit flavor goes really well with the tart flavor.

-Passion Fruit Green Tea: Perfect combo of sweetness/sourness/tea flavor

-Iced Milk Drink: Purple Kow's is definitely better. The milk of BB Tea's Iced Milk Drink did not sit well with my stomach and had a weird consistency.

I really like the menu of BB Tea Station because it shows how you can customize your drink very easily. However, I am super indecisiveness so I had a really hard time choosing a drink!

Employees are really nice. I accidentally ordered the wrong drink and she helped me remake it so long as I paid the price difference between the drinks. However, I did notice one time that I came here, this one employee made the drinks watered down but usually they are pretty spot on. 

They are currently under construction still but they usually have a few tables and games provided so you can chill and hang out with your friends here.
author: Alice C.

description:
So I saw the cashier (who is handling CA$H MONEY y'all) grab the cups with her fingers on the INSIDE of the rim after we paid. Then I witnessed an employee come in, clock in for his shift, go in the back, NOT wash his hands and also grab the INSIDE of the rim of the cups with his bare hand before he proceeded to make drinks. The kitchen area is very visible from the waiting area.

I honestly don't even remember what my drink tasted like (passionfruit green tea w/pearls) because I was so disturbed. I contemplated just throwing it out after I walked out of the shop but I couldn't swallow losing $4+ (I know, I'm dumb and cheap I guess). They also don't seal their drinks, they use regular lids, which irks me because I'm a spiller by nature. Also some AC would be nice, it's a little cramped and stuffy in here.

Please get it together. Wish you guys the best but I'm not going back.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
The green milk tea isn't the usual Jasmine green.  If it is, then the taste is really faint and nonexistent.  It just tastes like milky water.  The boba consistency was ok and the egg pudding was nothing special.

Their menu looks confusing.  But I always get Jasmine green milk tea so I didn't really pay attention to it.
author: Heejin L.

description:
As of late, every time that I'm in the area, I've been coming here cause this spot is BETTER than T-Pumps and other boba spots within its vicinity. I always get the milk tea and the flavor is spot on with just the right amount of boba. 

Here, you don't need to tell them how sweet you want it and you don't need to request extra boba as well cause they give you plenty in the first place.

The drawback......

CASH ONLY.
author: Marco M.

description:
Open Christmas until 12am! 
Good for people who like sweet tea and like adjusting sugar/ice levels as desired
author: Tricia T.

description: Solid boba place. They were out of boba somehow the day we were there, but still had popping boba. The original black milk tea at 50% sugar was fine; any more sugar would be too sweet. I think I prefer 'Wonderful Dessert & Cafe's milk tea more in that it has more of a tea flavor to it, although this one has more than Super Cue so that's good. These guys say they use juices to flavor everything that is flavored (vs powders and syrups). Couldn't really verify that with my own eyes, but I'd take juice over a powder or syrup any day.
author: Linus W.

description:
The best on Noriega. 

Welcoming staff and space to sit and stay make BB Tea a spot to go to. Located pretty strategically in an area with quite a few good eateries and not too many boba places to go to (unless you make the trek to Irving or Taraval), BB Tea is the place to grab a drink when you're in the area. Muni riders have the 7 and 28 lines to do you off pretty close to the place. I stop by here quite often when I'm heading to the bank or coming home. 

As for the tea itself, it's pretty on point. Boba and pudding make excellent toppings here, and even with less ice, sugar, and no toppings, BB Tea still offers a good milk tea to drink. They do offer other styles of drinks, but their milk tea is what you go here for. The snacks aren't mind blowing by any means and I don't think you would go here exclusively for them, but they do give you something to munch on. 

At the end of the day, because of its location and what it offers, BB Tea is a spot to check out. BB Tea sets itself apart from the competition with a taste that is interestingly unique to itself. Give it a try. 

BB Tea will forever remain as one of my personal favorites.
author: Aaron A.

description:
I just discovered this place!!! Definitely my new favorite boba place. I am going to have trouble not coming every day.

I particularly love the milk teas but I still have to try their others, they look pretty amazing as well.

Regular sweet is definitely on the sweeter side so I order 50% sweet. I love all the different flavors they have.

I'm a new regular here!
author: Lara M.

description: Good place to get drink, good customer service, decent prince and great atmosphere to hang out with friends.
author: Shirley G.

description: Saw a new boba place on Yelp and decided to give BB Tea Station a try. Ordered their Ice Milk Drink with Grass Jelly and Boba. The drink had a very creamy texture but the boba here was a bit too sweet. I really liked their logo here though. The downside was that I could not find any signs of a trash can inside the shop but they were actually in the planters outside. The owner is very friendly and makes makes very good drinks and also explained the contents of the drink to me. I also believe that the owner of BB Tea Station also owns Jojo's Cafe on Ocean in the Ingleside district.
author: Peter C.

description:
I was introduced to BB Tea Station by my girlfriend. This little place is located on Noriega and 20th ave. Their milk tea is mostly fruit flavored but they still have the basic regular milk tea & taro milk tea. It's not as crowded as the usual boba places like Quickly, PurpleKow, and TPumps, which is nice because your drink is ready pretty fast. And it's not loud as hell so you can order your drink with ease. The people are nice here.

I usually get the Mango Black Milk Tea with boba which, in my opinion, is my favorite mango flavored milk tea in SF. It isn't real mango but neither is TPumps, Quickly or most boba places. The mango BMT is sweet with a hint of sour, like a real mango but not overly sweet. The boba is chewy but not hard or mushy, just right in my opinion. It's also not 50% ice cube, rather it's like 8% shaved ice or whatever it called (which means more drink for you.

The price is pretty cheap as I would expect from a boba place. It's not hella cheap but not overly expensive. At about $3-$4 per drink, it's totally worth the price. 

It's also a nice place to hang out while you drink. They have like 2 or 3 games you can play, like Jenga or Airplane. 

(I still have yet to really try all the flavors because I always crave the mango bmt....)
author: Jeffrey C.

description: I went to this place after reading a long list of best boba spots in SF and this was one of the few places that I hadn't tried yet. I came at around 9 PM when they close at 10 PM and were out of BOBA. WHAT?! A boba spot out of boba.. kinda ridiculous because I'm sure lots of boba places make more when it runs out, but I assume that this place makes a batch at the beginning of the day and let it sit out there. gross. Instead I got the grass jelly with jasmine milk tea. It was decent, the grass jelly tasted better than other spots and it was easier to drink. Don't you hate it when they put BLOBS of grass jelly in your drink and you can never even suck it out?! Their jelly was firm and easy to drink so plus on that. Also beware that a sign says the restroom is out of order, but I really needed to go.. so I went and it worked perfectly fine!!! Soooooo misleading!
author: Anh Thu P.

description: Had their iced milk with grass jelly and boba, less sweet. If you want something refreshing without tea, get one of their iced milk drinks. A little slush, a little chewiness, and a little sweetness. Yum!!!
author: Kathleen P.

description:
I always love trying new boba places out, so when I was in the neighborhood, I could not wait to see how good their drinks are! It took me a long time to read their menu because some of the fonts are in such a light color (yellow?!?!). I opted to try the seasonal drink (pumpkin milk tea) and added boba to it. My drink was too sweet for me, and the boba were a little too hard for my taste. 

But the workers are so friendly!
author: Rachel H.

description:
It's not great, but it's not TERRIBLE. Well, it's not GOOD either.

They have a ridiculously HUGE cardboard menu...that is sitting on the counter. Seriously. It's about 4 feet tall. HANG THAT THING ON THE WALL! Geez.

They have a strange ordering system. A bunch of columns and dots. Whatever.

Their boba is way too undercooked. The center is HARD. No bueno. Also, for their iced milk drink the ice was shaved ice like they use for slushy drinks or whatever. Not good..
author: Susy C.

description: The staff were very personable and shared their favorites. I tried the honey dew and taro yogurt...the honey dew was slightly on the tart side.
author: Dee R.

description:
Bubble Milk Black or Green Tea with Flavours such as Pineapple, Honeydew, Green Apple, Kumquat, Lavendar, Honey and LOADS w Toppings such as Tapioca, Popping Boba, Lycgee Jelly, & Sweet Puddings! more not to mention the other Lovely drinks on the Menu. Cash Only. FREE Wifi, Sitting Lounge, Friendly Bubbly Service, & a Frequent Buyer Card! Conveniently located on Noriega near 19th Ave, spot in the Middle of Irving & Taraval Streets. I love it. 

Only thing I wish they had a bigger size cup to offer, again Cash Only, & no bogs. BUT overall I love coming here when I need a nice cup of Afternoon, Evening TEA!
author: Julian I.

description: First time trying this ... It was great! I ordered a lychee yogurt + heart jelly.  Not too sweet and refreshing.  I like the jelly is much better than boba.
author: Angela L.

description:
BEST BOBA!! ( In that area) 

If you are in that area, you HAVE to drop by for their boba! It's so sweet and there are plenty of flavors you can choose from! The bobas are neither soft or hard! Very chewy and I loved it! HIGHLY RECOMMEND! 

The inside: 
Plenty of tables and chairs to hang out with your friends. All their walls are pastel colored, so the place gives off a calm vibe. The employees there are pretty friendly and they seem to be younger ( like most boba places) There are also games there you can play with your friends. 


Parking: 
Parking there is not that great, so i recommend parking at least and block or so and just walk there. Burn off those calories ahead of time. 

What I ordered: 
Black tea boba 

Writing this review already makes me want to go back for their boba already! 

Highly recommend!!!!
author: Katy W.

description:
I don't get the hype... 


Look I drink a lot of boba, cause I coach a basketball team of Asian girls and guess what they want to do after every game/practice...... Get boba!

Anyways TMI, this place had great reviews and was on the top 11 places to get boba in SF on facebook, so we thought we'd give it a shot.  

I got the lychee milk tea, Gf got milk tea, little guy got mango "Ice snow?" 

Mine was too sweet, the milk tea was watered down, reminded me of beach boba (now closed) and the mango.... Well I didn't try it


However thumbs up on the boba! Great texture, and consistency.  It was pretty good, definitely near the top! 

I probably won't come back unless someone mentions it.... Ehh I'm sure I'll find my way back somehow 

 out!
author: Jorlyn W.

description:
I was looking for a boba place when walking around Noriega and found BB Tea Station on Yelp. I'm up to get boba anytime and anywhere, so I walked in. I wanted to get flavors that I don't usually go for, so I ordered a Coconut Green Tea and a Lavender Black Milk Tea, which were both $3.40 - not a bad price at all! Topping add-ons are $0.50 each.

I had to wait a little longer because they were out of boba, but I didn't mind since they said it'll be done in 5 minutes. When I got my drinks, the first thing I noticed was the ice floating on top (don't judge me lol). Instead of being your typical ice cubes, the ice in our drinks were more "shaved", which I liked. They provided our drinks with a lot of boba, which was a little hard to chew. The drinks themself were okay. The coconut green tea tasted vaguely like iced coffee, and the lavender black tea was a little watered down - I could barely taste the lavender. 

But one that that really stood out to me was that the staff working there said "thank you" to me three times, and I felt that they really enjoyed working there. It made the whole ambiance of the store feel uplifting. I would stop by again, since the prices aren't too bad, and the staff is nice.
author: Vivian T.

description:
I discovered this place after moving back to SF couple months ago. Came here with my friend after getting lunch and i instantly got hooked on their iced milk! 

This place is fairly small with couple tables and some table top games you can play with while waiting for your drink. Their menu isn't that big, which is great so it's easy to figure what you want to order. I've only tried their iced milk before and it's the ONLY think i get whenever i come here. Remember to mix the drink beforehand so you'll mix the flavor with the milk. I always get G1 or G7 and both are my favorite! 

I am addicted to BB Tea Station and their iced milk!
author: Jenny G.

description:
I couldn't figure out the menu at all. Call me slow, but it's hard to figure out, especially if you've got a slightly impatient cashier tapping on her register, and a line out the door behind you. So, no fancy order for me. Just their regular fare milk tea because instead of having a normal menu everyone knows how to read, they gotta be unique and have a bunch of dots. Ever hear the saying "If it ain't broke, don't fix it?"

Milk tea was standard. A little bit too sweet for my tastes to be honest, but hey I couldn't figure out if I could half the sugar or not. So my fault right? I did like the little cow sticker on the side of my boba though. At least I'll get entertained by cuteness while getting my drink on.

This place is slightly passable, but then again I probably would have had a better time if I read the spark notes on their menu.
author: Sean H.

description:
BB tea station looks barren (of decor) yet clean, new, and fresh. the laminated menu was hard to read at first. then i got it. 

the offerings (milk tea, boba, .... )and pricing is listed across the top of the board. the various flavors offered are listed straight down on the left side.

pour: honeydew milk tea(2.90)
-very milky, prominent honeydew sweet taste
-green tea barely tasted. on the edge of freshness.
3.5 stars

drips:
-15% grand opening special
-cashier spoke good english and cantonese...
-not top tier drink, definietly top of 2nd tier milk teas. 
-fast, friendly service.
author: Victor G.

description:
I come here almost two days a week, because it's very close to my house 
However I think the milktea is just okay, nothing too special but I like the latte most. I really like the menu and the setting of that place, cause very cute.
The owner is very nice, and there's a grandpa always sit there (I guess is the owner father, very cute)
I had tried lavender black milktea, mango milktea, hot mango tea, forget what but it's latte, and ice milk with caramel pudding and boba.
The boba is just really depends, sometime is very chewy but some time just wait too long..

Get mango milktea if you first go there (: won't disappointed you I guess
author: Kassidi L.

description:
The menu confuses me a little, it's too busy. I'm all for cute and whatever, but it seems like they put WAY too much thought into the menu design. Whatever. The milktea is actually good here. I ordered the green milk tea, it was jasmine milk tea. Is it me or is "jasmine green tea" the only "green tea" people seem to know around these parts?
