But hey, at least the tea part of the milktea was distinguishable, and that in itself deserves big props to me.

My friend said that the interior reminded her of Quickly's.
author: Stacy C.

description:
Stopped by for a quick drink. They have quite the selection so choose wisely. Shame that I was in a hurry and only got myself a green milk tea with large tapioca.

The drink itself was a sweet with just a hint of bitterness from the tea, but the best part was the boba peals. They had the right texture for me and along with the nice sweetness and chew to them, they were by far the highlight of the drink.

When asking for a regular milk tea, make sure to let them know if you want a green tea instead of black tea because I'm guessing the default option is black.
author: George Z.

description: I've been coming to this place every now and then since they've opened. I still never found a drink I completely love, but if I'm ever around and just want something, this would probably do. When I used to come often, they remembered us and even our orders. It's a decent place overall
author: Maggie W.

description: One of the many tapioca places in the sunset that doesn't disappoint. I ordered the iced milk tea with grass jelly and tapioca, and I really liked it. My friend's raspberry green tea tasted pretty good too, although it reminded me of Snapple. My other friend's peach green milk tea was alright. The place itself is pretty roomy and clean. There's a cute menu with a list of all the drinks, which I regrettably didn't take a picture of. Overall, not amazing, but not bad either. I would come back if I were in the area.
author: Corinna T.

description: After my friend recommended it and saw it on an SF list of must-try boba, I decided to come and try this place. I came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was very quiet. I was the only customer. I got the Mango Bubble Green Milk Tea with boba and paid in cash because that was the only acceptable form of payment. My drink came quickly, and it was actually a pretty decent size for its price. The drink, however, was not what I had hoped for. I look for stronger tea flavors in my milk tea, and this one had too much milk for my taste. I would not come back because there are much better boba places in Sunset than this one.
author: Regina L.

description:
Where I'm from (Orange County) there were at LEAST 5 boba shops within walking distance of my house. So, I'm rating this from an extremely spoiled point-of-view. Additionally, I used to work part-time for a boba shop near school during my younger years allowing me to rate also, using my boba-girl wisdom: frankly, I'm not impressed. The menu is simple, and hopefully so are you because that's all you're getting.

They have a dot system to guide you as to what you can get and how you can get it. Unfortunately, there's plenty you can't get. Let me try a simple one. Can I have strawberry and peach tea? No, because their heads will explode if they have to figure out how many pumps it takes and the recipe instructions just aren't there or what to charge me for this crazy concoction I've devised. The cashier's answer to my request was, "We don't mix." I had to pick my jaw up off the floor after a second or two of confusion and then, safely purchased a peach tea.

I am certain I don't foam at the mouth to get boba here, but if I were so inclined and happen to be in the area shoving Booming dim sum's goodies in my mouth I might stop by for a drink. A simple one.
author: Sam H.

description:
I really didn't need to see another study guide/chart/organizer thing outside of class, especially as a drinks menu. There is nothing wrong with standard menus that are easy on the eyes! When you get there, be prepared for an interesting menu setup. 

However, their milk drinks definitely made up for their "stylish" menu! The caramel in their milk drinks add a great taste to the drink that does not overpower the taste of the milk. They also gladly did substitutions and switched out boba for pudding in my drink. I tried my friend's drink to taste the boba, and all the toppings I tried (boba, pudding, grass jelly) were on point and fresh! Nice consistency and taste overall, so I would definitely visit again. It's much better than PurpleKow with less wait time!
author: Wiemond W.

description: Little cute boba place on Noriega. The boba is chewy and pretty good, can't compare to Purple Kow boba though. The ice milk was a little too sweet for my taste and it was weird, when I got my drink I wasn't expecting frozen ice milk. You have to mix in the milk or it'll be really sweet. the cup design is cute though and the drink was decent.
author: Celine C.

description:
Bubbly, delicious milk teas that are simple and to the point.

Their menu is somewhat confusing, but I warmed up to it after a friendly explanation from the staff.

Bobas are chewy, not too hard or too soft, and their flavors are quite solid, though some may find it a bit sweeter than a lot of the competition out there.

They probably still need some more work on getting the decor up to snuff, but their branding is fun and interesting - they just need to push it over the finish line.
author: Anthony N.

description: I got a regular milk tea with boba here. It was just okay. If you want boba in the area, it is not a bad place to go but I've had better.
author: C M.

description: This place probably has the best honey dew milk tea I have tasted and I only drink that exact flavor whenever I go to a milk tea place. Place is a little small. The workers are really friendly and welcoming. They have some games there to play as well and everything is very clean inside . This place is good if you want to just hangout with your friends and chat or just grab a quick drink to go ! Plus there are a lot of food places nearby.
author: Jon H.

description:
So I was finally able to try the boba with the iced milk drink! Eureka!!! lol.

The owner told me and my friends we had to wait 20 minutes for the 2nd round of boba to be cooked but since we weren't rushing anywhere, we had no problem waiting.

Got an iced milk drink w/ boba and grass jelly. Half sweet. It was definitely worth the wait for the boba - it was nice, sweet boba which made the drink just sweet enough. 

I tried my friend's egg pudding iced milk drink w/ boba too - regular sweet and it actually wasn't too sweet as regular sweet. It's quite interesting. 

Overall - my 2nd experience here definitely made me a fan. :) 

Nice cashier and nice owner. :)
author: Susan Y.

description: After hearing rave reviews about this place, my cousins and I decided to give this place a try. We had the G5 (Ice Milk Drink with Caramel and Egg Pudding. No Boba), G7 (Ice Milk Drink with Caramel, Grass Jelly, and Boba), Lavender Milk Tea (No Boba), and the Mango Milk Tea (No Boba). We also bought the marine animal shaped seaweed cookies for $1.00 (Pretty worth it)!! All the drinks were pretty good, but the clear winner was the Lavender Milk Tea. If you're ever in the area, you should definitely give this place a try! :)
author: Emily L.

description:
I've only been here once and I didn't really enjoy it, but I'm willing to give it another chance since a lot of people seem to like it here. I got the iced milk drink with caramel and pudding which seems to be popular among people here. 
I didn't really like it at first, but the more I drank it, the better it got. I'm not going to say this is one of the better drinks I've had before. I'm more of a milk tea person. I tried my friend's passion black milk tea but since my drink was so sweet, I couldn't taste hers lol. 
So I guess this place is worth to check out. I personally enjoy t pumps better but a lot of people seem to like this place better so it really just depends on the person. 
& don't forget CASH ONLY***
author: Andrea M.

description:
Not sure how long it has been open, but it definitely is very clean and has a new vibrate look. 

They have 3 large tables for groups of 6 and a few smaller tables for couples. They also have some board games for entertainment as well as a TV that shows dramas. 

I had the hot jujube honey tea that was pretty good.
Lots of students from the school near by seem to frequent the place for boba milk tea.

Staff is friendly and helpful.

I don't recommend any of their snack foods.
author: Michael S.

description: My go-to boba place in the Sunset. They have a wide selection of flavors and the standard toppings all at a great price. Because there are so many different possible flavor + topping combinations, the trick is really finding what you like and sticking with it. (For me it's usually taro or honey plus boba). A very solid place overall.
author: Lawrence W.

description:
I love boba and this did not disappoint! I got the passion fruit milk green tea, which was flavorful and the boba was super soft! I like that they offer a lot of other fruity flavors as well. 

They also have a fair amount of seating and games to play while youre there!
author: Nicole L.

description:
Honestly, for some reason, I've always been skeptical of the quality of BB Tea Station's drinks. Probably cause I haven't heard any hype about it. I've often passed by BB at night, and it always seemed quieter and less busy compared to other boba places. I guess you could say I'd been opting for my go-to boba places, instead of giving BB a try. It was actually my friend who suggested we try it after we had lunch.

I decided to order the BB iced milk with green tea, no boba. I was pleasantly surprised! It tasted refreshing, good mix of both milk and green tea, not too heavy and not too sweet either. This was my first time ordering an iced milk drink though, so I have nothing to compare it to. I also appreciated that the guy who made my drink advised me to mix my drink well since the tea is at the bottom. :)

Like others have mentioned, the menu is confusing! I found myself staring at the menu for a few minutes, trying to figure out how to read it. I love color, and I liked the colors they used for each item on the menu, but the dots just made the menu too busy and confusing. 

The place itself is simply furnished, but painted with vibrant colors, which gave me a cheerful vibe. I noticed some games in the back, which is nice of them to provide, but I wondered briefly if they had gotten the idea from Craftea lol. I dunno, there's just something about BB that doesn't seem as inviting as other boba places. Perhaps it's the overall presentation? I noticed that they merely put a sticker with their logo onto the cup. I liked the iced milk a lot, but I think I'd still opt for my usual go-to boba places to get my boba fix. Sorry to say this, but for me, BB is a good back-up for boba, if I don't want to wait in line elsewhere.
author: Emily L.

description:
-Seating area is comfy looking & the vibe of the place = nice

-Liked how this place was "hidden" (not crowded) compared to other popular boba places like Quickly's & Purple Kow 

-The menu is SOMEWHAT confusing, but the fact that there are a lot of options in the color spectrum is good

-There was no trashcan inside of the store, which is why I saw people going up to an employee, asking where it was. Outside of the boba store, are decorations of flowers in wooden boxes, and the boxes are actually trashcans. It would be more convenient if the trash cans were inside of the store.


Overall, the service & drink I received makes me want to earn more stamps on my stamp card to get a free drink.
author: Erica K.

description:
THIS PLACE IS AWESOME. Reminds me of Half and Half in LA. The iced milk drinks are their specialty and it is very similar to the ones at Half and Half. 
+they speak Cantonese :D
author: Jeffrey T.

description:
There are two drinks I absolutely love here (that make this place 5-stars in my book):

(1) GINGER GREEN TEA with REAL ginger bits!! I have not yet found another place that serves such great ginger tea with real bits. Also unlike most other places that only serve this hot, the ginger tea here is available both iced and hot.

(2) JUJUBE DATE TEA with REAL dates!! Yummmm.

Both the grass jelly and boba are consistently good. The boba is the perfect amount of sweet and chewy. 

I *think* they use real tea leaves for the tea.. The drinks here are overall solid, though some of the fruity teas taste too sweet and artificial (from the syrup). I would honestly stay away from the fruity teas.

The owner & workers are also super super friendly! And they have board games! One of my go-to place in Sunset :)
author: Samantha C.

description: Great place to get a refreshment after having a great meal over at new taraval cafe! This is a cash only establishment so don't forget your $.
author: Eric S.

description:
MEGA MEGA MEGA SWEET!
believe me, when i say its sweet cause normally i love sweet but this just tasted like ehhhhh no flavor, made the mistake my 1st time there. and learned to just ask for 3/4 sweet and its perfect.

I've had their green milk tea and peach black milk tea both are good, the menu is pretty good size so lots of options for everyone. the boba was good/ met my standard of good boba. 

i feel like ill be going to this place more just because parking is a lil easier to find on noriega compared to irving and taraval 

the place used to be another tapioca placed which was also good but just never really had anyone in there. glad to see there another tapioca company is there taking its place. 

furniture is a lil odd but it matches the theme/idea of the place.

very much a place ill just take my boba and go but glad to have the option to stay and sit/hangout for a bit
author: Matt F.

description:
I got the ginger tea with black tea and I was surprised to find a tea bag in my drink. I guess it's nice to know that my leaves are fresh but there was barely any ginger flavor, actually, any flavor at all. Since I waited 10 minutes to get my drink I'm disappointed that it was lacking. 
On the other hand, my friend got the ice milk with taro and boba and it was so much better! Taro and boba on the bottom and and a milk slushy on top, just mix and you're ready!
author: Monica S.

description: Decent boba place in the sunset but does not let you mix flavors except for the honey lemon one. The boba is soft and chewy just the way I like it. I always get the pomergrante green tea with half the sugar and half the amount of ice and it is just perfect!
author: Janet Z.

description:
Came here for the first time to catch up with my bestie. Then met up with the bf and the little brother. So many choices.. I wanted to try everything. We were instantly greeted and the staff was very friendly. We arrived one hour before closing and there was only one table that was taken but slowly it filled up. There were people who arrived a minute before closing but the staff weren't being rude about it and were happy to take their orders. 

My bestie had the honeydew yogurt with boba. I had the matcha green milk tea. The bf went with the green milk tea and the little brother had the taro milk tea. My first visit and I've already tried four drinks.

All the drinks were good but just a tad too sweet so maybe I will try to order it less sweet the next time I come again. Their boba is very delicious though and the texture is perfect. 

Will definitely be back.
author: Vanessa Y.

description: Construction is now finished at this place. The walls are beautifully painted and there are 2 fish tanks. The cafe provides a decent amount of board games and there are plenty of places to sit. The staff are friendly and pretty fast, although my drink was slightly under filled. I ordered the strawberry black milk tea with boba, and it tasted delicious. The trash cans were hidden on the inside, but I did find two outside. I'll probably keep coming back to this place.
author: Jessica G.

description:
As a milk-tea junkie, this place is "average". I am not a fan of their milk teas or lattes, but I like most of their regular flavored teas!

Their flavored milk-teas have a weird buttery taste, which is I really dislike. A lot of their flavored teas are very artificial tasting considering they use real fruit juice. The ones that aren't as artificial tasting are very refreshing.

I love that their menu it's creative and non-traditional. Bummer they could've done something similar with their stamp card system.

Overall this place has a nice and bright environment for people to just chill! They also have board games for people to play while they wait for drinks or just play the night away.
author: Oriel F.

description: Came here after dinner with boba princess after a YEE event. There was no lines around 10:30 p.m and no one was in there on a Friday night. Usually, I see people hanging out. Hmm, maybe it isn't a hangout place? BB Tea Station is located in Outer Sunset. I just had the regular milk tea without boba. I thought the tea was decent.
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description:
I don't know about everyone else, but I like their little chart menu. To me it was pretty easy to follow. The row is for flavors, and the columns are for drink type (fruit tea, yogurt, milk tea, etc.) and the circle in that cell indicates they have that combination. Maybe I just like things more condensed and efficient than having gigantic boards with repetitive lines of small text like they have at Quickly. 

There's nothing particularly special about their drinks and it's basically the same as what you find at the other more popular boba places. But since it's not as high profile, it's not as packed and you don't have to wait forever for a drink. It tastes the same and costs a little less too.

The decor aims to be cute. Their little cow logo gave me the sudden urge to play Harvest Moon too. Seating is kinda limited, which is true for every other boba place in the area. But this place actually has the space to put up seats, so it's kind of weird they don't try to add more of them.

I liked the service here. I noticed lots of people got confused by their chart menu but the people at the counter were more than happy to explain things to everyone, even if they had to repeat themselves multiple times. They don't have as many people working too, so behind the counter doesn't look like the inside of a sweatshop. But they're still able to get you your drinks quickly.
author: Allen C.

description: Meh. I've had better. I got the black milk tea with boba. Cute logo with cow, so why not give it a try? Plus, its been in my bookmark for a while. The milk tea was watered down and I was trying to will myself to like something about it but I just can't. Sorry, won't be returning.
author: Eugenia G.

description:
Roughly every single modern asian american in San francisco is quite keen to investigating and patronizing the different boba/milk tea locations in the bay area, and the hierarchy is generally pretty clear with Quickly's at the dirt bottom of the totem pole.

Powdered crap, high amounts of syrup, more ice than tea, every single little detail is scrutinized to such an extent, it gains much more publicity than Kim Kardashian did when we first heard about which straw she decided to put in her cup. :p

As of 6/21/2014, the newest hype thus far that i know of is ShareTea.

By comparison, this place is no Sharetea, but it's not bad either

+The drinks here taste pure, and by that, i mean you don't get that soury/putrid aftertaste you endure if you had ordered any comparable drink from Quickly's
.
+The location's interior is cramped, much smaller than ShareTea's San Francisco Location but at least for the most part it is fairly clean

+All of the little board games and kiddie chairs around remind me of what you expect from a toddlers day care center. But i guess it does work as a way of being different.

+Cheapest Price of a drink to my knowledge is about $3.15 w/o toppings.
Still better than parking in some places, and fairly cheaper than Bambu.

-Snack Options: meh, maybe its just not my thing, but they continue to show off their seaweed crackers, or seaweed goldfish if you prefer to call it that way.
That maybe the one spot that Quickly's got correct in providing taste but not so healthy hot snacks.....actually i take that back, Bambu is on a better track in that case....

Would i come back here? For the most part yes
Do they still have a long way to go? Food wise yes.
Is their drink worth the wait if you're in the area? Yes.
Bring a date here? No.
author: Eric C.

description:
This place was surprisingly pretty good. Stumbled upon it while having dinner across the street. 

Pros: 
-stamp cards - for someone who loves dessert and most importantly boba, a stamp card is beneficial and rewarding!
- good drinks - so far all the drinks I've tried have been pretty good and packed with favor. Their drinks are on the sweeter side though (just an FYI for people who like very little or no sweet tea)
-good location with easy Parking and good amount of seating inside
-games inside to keep you entertain if you come with friends and want something to do 

Cons 
- 2 times I've gone and they ran out of boba (for some reason I've never had this happened). Once was at night (unserstandable) and the other time was later afternoon (4pm), which I'm not so forgiving about. 
- only two people working and it can take some time to get your drink if there's a lot lf people and one person is taking orders and other is making the drink 

Overall this is a pretty good place. Go here if you like purple kow because their g5 is a dupe except it has a cup that actually fits your cars cup holder. They also have a lot of other misc flavors of teas to add and try! 

Yah new favorite boba place! 
(Compared to tpumps boba guys purple kow tea way)
author: Suzie B.

description:
A new boba spot to hit my neighborhood? Nice! 

Ordered a lychee green tea with boba and asked for it to be slightly sweetened with a little ice (since it's freezing outside). My drink was $4.00 and something cents but after leaving the change as a tip, it came out to being $5.00, which I guess is pretty standard these days. Although I remember my boba obsession being cheaper... Anyways! My drink came out to be very yummy, a little too sweet for my liking, but still good. The girl at the counter was sweet and dealt with my annoying order, so thank you :) 

I'll be back!
author: Anastasia N.

description:
I had Black Peach Milk Tea with boba. I also tried Black Honeydew Milk Tea with boba and Black Lychee Milk Tea with popping boba.

It's EXPENSIVE. I think it's comparable to T-pumps, but I don't think an order of boba should come out to $11.00 +. The person behind me payed $4.45 for her drink at the same size which is WAYYY expensive. I think that the price for a regular iced black milk tea drink is around $3.50 or more, the menu was confusing. However, I think that the size of the drink is reasonable. 

It looks cute from the inside. The inside is cute too, although there's not that much room. There are games to play in the back. 

In terms of taste, I wasn't WOWED. It was definitely good though as I expected it would be. It didn't have a powdery taste.

The best out of the three was the Black Lychee Milk Tea with boba. It had a very nice lychee taste to it. The boba was also nice and chewy.

Overall, it tasted good. However, I will not return regularly because of the price. It's a nice one time thing.
author: Carina M.

description:
I love swinging by BB Tea Station when I'm in the area! A recent favorite drink of mine here is the matcha milk tea. My usual problem with matcha milk teas is either it's too sweet or not enough matcha flavor. It has just the right balance of matcha and sweetness. I've also tried the iced milk, which I liked (even though iced milks aren't my favorite drink). My brother swears by their strawberry milk tea. And he doesn't swear by anything. Their menu is large, so there should be something for everyone in your group.

As for the store itself. Service can be slow, depending on when you go. But BB Tea Station looks like a great place to hang out with some friends. There's free wi-fi, and games to play during your time there. Seating seems kind of limited to me, but I'm not sure how crowded it gets, given that there are a few dessert places nearby anyway.

All in all, I would recommend anyone to give BB Tea Station a try.
author: Denise C.

description:
I heard a lot of my friends talking about how good this place is, how there's no line and it's pretty cheap compared to Purple Kow and Quicklys, so I decided to come here with my cousins today.
When we first stepped in, we were greeted right away and the place looked really cute, especially their logo. My cousins and I didn't know what to get and the owner was nice enough to recommend some drinks for us. I ended up getting the boba ice milk tea. My cousin got a regular milk tea and my other cousin got a lavender milk tea. Our order came up to $10.76, which was pretty cheap for 3 drinks. After we ordered, we sat down at one of the tables and I realized there was a couch and a table with games on a shelf further inside the store. We decided to play Jenga while waiting for our drinks and it was  ready within 10 minutes. When I went up to grab my boba ice milk tea, the owner said "stir it well because all the flavor is at the bottom!" and smiled.
Overall, I would recommend this place to my friends and family. This place is by far the best boba place around with a cheap price and no wait/lines. They have great customer service and the place is cute!
author: Vicky L.

description: I really love this place! I have to admit that I'm not the biggest milk tea or boba lover, but that's why BB Tea Station shines. They offer different drinks, like icy milks & yogurt drinks. I'm a dedicated "icy milk" fan & almost always get the G5 (pudding, caramel, & boba), but leave out the boba. It's the perfect balance of not-so-sweet for me. The yogurt drinks are also really great because they're actually tart & there are a million different flavors.
author: Ruby H.

description: BB Tea Station is a pretty solid choice for bubble tea in San Francisco. This place reminds me a lot of Tpumps. The boba is really soft and chewy. The tea is good: not too sweet, but not super bitter either. But unlike Tpumps, I got a good amount of boba! Huzzah!
author: Mark C.

description:
Their menu is huge! 
I took a long time examining their lengthy menu. I would say it was more distracting than helpful but at least they have a lot of variety. I ordered the milk drink with pudding and boba and it was pretty good. Honestly don't think you can mess up a milk drink. My favorite part of this boba place is that there were cards and Jenga sets for the guests so my friends and I stayed here for quite some time. 

Did I mention Jenga? This place gets 4 stars for having Jenga.

Jenga
author: Andy C.

description: Currently remodeling, but still have lots of empty seats. Customer service could be better. Drinks are delicious esp. their honeydew mt. Their drinks make up for the cons. Their cards and "toys" are sticky. Quick and fast good for take out.
author: Ricky C.

description: Love black milk tea with boba although I wish it had a little bit more tea.The boba is soft and chewy and doesn't have that metallic after taste. :)
author: Joanna L.

description:
My new favorite boba place.

The people working there are very friendly, and the milk tea is great (it's on the sweeter side, so I order 50% sweet). I'm going to have a hard time stopping myself from coming here every day... sooo good.
author: Justin C.

description: Yeeeee... got the last of the boba for the night on Friday! My go-to here is... ice milk with boba and grass jelly. Love that the drinks here aren't too sweet for my liking either. Cash only!!
author: Ann T.

description: The caramel black milk tea is delicious! Ingredients taste fresh and the sweetness level is just right. I also saw someone get the lavender black milk tea and I know I'll be ordering that next
author: Vivian W.

description:
We came here last weekend right before they closed, the male cashier (owner??) was nice and provided excellent service. The drink was ok (just a regular milk tea with boba), could be better.

The decor & menu was nice =)
author: Jenn J.

description: I've tried well over 15 different flavors of drinks here and the quality never disappoints! The tea is fresh and the milk teas are always creamy. I dont know how they do it, but this is one of the top milk tea places imo. Unfortunately they spend a little more time making it taste so good, so you always have to wait a little before you get your drink. Luckily, it's not an overhyped place like TPumps so you should find this place either empty or with a short line!
author: Holly P.

description:
Boba. Tapioca. Pearl. 

However you call it, this place is nice to go to. Not bad on a place that is quiet.

-Parking can be nice or hard to find.
-Price is fair
-Seating is 50/50, you either have a chair or you don't.

Great for family, friends and all a like.
author: Michael C.

description: I tried so many boba please and this is the best I ever had before. Drinks are always the good, unlike purple kow cant keep the qualities on drinks. The store provides tables and chairs for people to hang out, and they also have little games. Unlike some boba places that you only stand in line, grab the drinks then you got to leave :( VIP customes also can store their stamp cards in the store  which is excellent idea for people who always forgot the bring their stamp cards, bravo! Staffs are very nice and fun:)  Try their secret menu, peppermint peach milk green tea, this is one of my favroit drink!
author: Yong Y.

description:
Good:
Peach Black Milk Tea
Almond Green Milk Tea
Coconut Green Milk Tea
Lychee Milk Tea

Not recommend:
Regular/House Black/Green Milk Tea
the smoothies

The staff is friendly and they have board games to play as you wait for your order.
author: Derek M.

description: Was around the area and was craving for some milk tea. Not a lot of places to sit but the service was good and I got my jasmine milk tea. Will come back if I'm around the area.
author: La G.

description: I ordered 2 black milk teas on a Saturday afternoon, and there was maybe one person ahead. I waited almost 15 minutes for them to come up and they were cool not cold and more watery than I expected. I don't know if I'd go back, which is a shame, because it looks like they have a good flavor selection (pineapple, kumquat, honeydew... plenty to choose from) and the boba was cooked fairly well. There's just no reason for a beverage to take that long.
author: Jessica Z.

description:
BB Tea Station drinks are way too sweet even for my sweet tooth!

On my first visit, I ordered an almond black milk tea, less sweet, with grass jelly.  Where's the tea taste?  This tasted like a sweet almond drink rather than a flavored milk tea.  It was "perfect" after I went home and added brewed tea to it.

So on my second visit, I went with a plain black milk tea, less sweet, but this was also too sweet even without any add-ins.  It tasted like sweet milk with barely any tea taste and was ok only after I went home and added brewed tea to it.  I shouldn't have to go home and tweak a milk tea from a tea place.

I decided to give this place one last chance so that I can try their iced milk drink.  On my third and final not-so-charmed visit, which was also my friend's birthday weekend, we asked the cashier if they would honor the free birthday drink (as advertised on their facebook page) even though it was the day before her actual birthday.  The cashier asked the manager in charge, and the answer was "no".  So we decided to go support a different tea place that day.  We were new repeat paying customers...but not anymore since the drinks aren't good enough to make up for that experience.

Sorry, BB Tea Station.  You have cute outdoor seating and plenty of indoor space, but you disappointed me three times.  I wanted to like you, but I liked you better before you replaced Fluffy Snow.

P.S. Their awkward lime green indoor chairs fit child-size butts.
author: Pam L.

description: Super slow and bad customer service. They don't care you are waiting for ordering, no words. Two people gone behind and doing something but never even say hi to customers.
author: Micky F.

description:
Black bubble milk tea with boba, light sweet.  What a misleading name, 'bubble milk tea', because it doesn't include boba...have to add 50c for that.  Although to be fair, in Chinese on the menu, it does literally say 'bubble milk tea'.  But, there aren't really any bubbles or foam either.  Overall decent milk tea, good enough for me to make a quick stop if I'm nearby.  

Don't really see why the menu had to be so cluttered and long... I stood in front of it for a bit just analyzing and deciphering the options.

I generally don't like walls blocking off the view of the milk tea in the making.  It's a bit suspicious, no?
author: Renee L.

description: Super Bad cup design which the lid is not sealed and the store logo is a sticker. Feels cheap and inconvenient to use. Speaking of the drink itself, lychee yogurt drink tastes bad. Apple green tea tastes oddly. Came here on the opening day now I Will not come back again.
author: Xx Z.

description:
I was extremely hot and thirsty so I decided to walk a mile to get some boba tea at BB Tea Station.  The place was HOT inside - no air conditioning!  And the wait was about 10 minutes, even though there were only a few people ahead of us.

Then my tea ended up being mostly luke warm - and mostly milk!  There was very little tea taste to it at all, and certainly no color contribution.  But the worst part is that, even though I was incredibly thirsty, it just wasn't tasty enough that I really enjoyed drinking it.  I thought that was really strange.  Usually when I'm thirsty I like most liquids.

So, 2 stars because they didn't do anything rude / unethical.  But I will avoid going here in the future.
author: Jon E.

description:
Yay for the Lavender Black/Green Milk Tea!

While I was having this drink, I thought to myself... I could drink this everyday for the rest of my life! Of course, that's exagerrated, but the drinks and boba here are superb! The boba had the perfect texture and taste. I'm definitely coming back to try the other flavors!

Also, the fish tank is awesome! I personally have done fish keeping in the past, and the fact that they are able to house Angelfish with San Francisco's water is impressive skill!
author: John H.

description:
This review is for the ice milk only. 

My search for ice milk that is slushy and blended is finally over! 

After moving back to SF, I missed San Diego's InifiniTea ice milk drink and this hits the spot! 

My only complaint was they ran out of boba mid-day and so I only got an ice milk drink with caramel pudding. 

It was still delish and the other drinks looked tasty! 

Will definitely be back :)
author: Alison N.

description:
I came here with a few friends who have never had boba, and boy did the menu confuse the heck out of them. Not only them, but I was incredibly overwhelmed my first time here given the chart of crazy colors. Its meant to give an idea of which combos are offered and which aren't but since 98% of them are possible, the whole thing should be simplified. 

Their ice milk drinks are pretty popular but I prefer milk teas. I tried both the black and green milk tea with boba and pudding, but both were meh. Too milky for me and boba seems okay.

What did surprise me was coming here an hour before closing and having them run out of boba. EH? How does that happen when you are a BOBA shop. But according to the other reviews, this happens quite frequently so beware.
author: Wendy N.

description: I ordered the red bean almond tea here and it was a little bit too sweet even though i asked for it to be less sweet.  There's one employee here at the register and one behind the counter making the drink, so with you have someone in front of you ordering 5 drinks you have a long wait.  This place is better compared to quickly and tea way, but don't expect anything too fancy from here.
author: Belinda C.

description: I've only gotten 1 drink here so far, it's the matcha milk tea (hot) with pudding. A little pricy compared to other places, but the matcha is actually noticeable. The guy who took my order was really thoughtful to put a cut on the drink cap for a straw to fit in for the pudding, since the cap was for coffee.
author: Derrick G.

description: Frequenting this place since opening. Best tea ever. Too bad they close early but screw it still dänk
author: Thomas H.

description: Great place to chat and hang with friends. Their milkteas are all so great, especially the ones in the "G" category. Its really worth for a try.
author: YY Z.

description:
I don't know if it's just me... but this place is not the best place to get boba /: 

I've been here multiple times because I didn't want the shitty milk tea from golden island but this place is no better

In my opinion, it's way too sweet.. I've tried so many things on the menu and I still find everything sweet as hell. And I have the biggest sweet tooth! 

Service is alright, they're all nice and friendly. Well lit, and I think there are games for you to play with.
author: Tracy V.

description: Great service! Green milk tea with pudding is delicious. They somehow made it so there is pudding in every sip. I always have pudding leftover at the end of my drinks at other places, not not here. The pudding is tasty not watered down gelatin. Iced milk drink is good too! Be sure to stir before drinking.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
The black milk tea did not have a tea taste. It left me a bit confused. The menu took me a while to decipher too. On the plus side, the decor looks good and they are offering 15% off right now for their grand opening, but unfortunately I will not be returning.

My tummy gives BB Tea Station...2 Stars!
author: Allan L.

description:
I love to support local businesses, GOOD local businesses at that.  I work in the Sunset and I didn't even realize that there was a new boba shop that took over where Fluffy Snow used to be. So glad because what a pleasant surprise it was! The staff were so friendly. I ordered a peach green tea boba, and it was perfect! Perfect level of sweet (I hate drinking pure syrup) and the boba balls were sweet and chewy. I would order this again and again, and  look forward to try their other drinks. 

Thumbs up!
author: Mimi S.

description: Why is this place rated so high? All our milk teas were so diluted they tasted like nothing. The matcha tasted like water and powder. Only the passion fruit green tea was passable. We went on a Sunday afternoon so we don't know if it was the particular person on duty or that's how their drinks are normally. Currently would not recommend. Would even advise against.
author: Fanny G.

description:
Menu is large and takes a little to figure out but is simple enough once you get past how large it is. 

This place is better than the boba tea I've had on Irving, with more choices as well. They have yogurt flavored drinks and many flavors/toppings the other stores don't. 

Had Honey Green Milk Tea and Lychee Yogurt drink, both without any toppings. I drank the tea immediately; good flavor with medium sweetness from the honey. Sweeter than some stores on Irving but not overpowering. The Lychee was for a friend but he already got something so I saved it for dinner...it foamed up/broke down a bit in fridge but otherwise was still tasty after I gave it a small shake to give it back some of its texture.

Staff was friendly and inviting. Layout is a bit odd...serving counter off to the side instead of up front facing the door. Fair amount of seating with a TV mounted on the wall. 

Will be back to try some other concoctions.
author: Alfred D.

description: Love this place. Their tea just get better & better every time. Love the ppl here too!
author: Michele T.

description: I've now been here 3 times and am still a big fan. Service is friendly and they are nice about combining your punch cards if you have multiple cards. I love the variety of choices available, but keep coming back to the caramel milk tea with pudding as my go to. They are also nice about lowering the amount of sugar if you ask.  They haven't started serving hot milk tea drinks as they are still working on maintaining overall consistency with their flavors, but I am looking forward to that. I'm hoping the rest of the neighborhood catches onto this wonderful spot, but hopefully they don't start attracting a line out the door like T Pumps. Hopefully they are here to stay for a while!
author: Alice H.

description:
Big menu to choose from. picking verity a flavor and different type of drink. It is amazing. I wanted to try it all. The milk drinks sometimes has a little odd flavor.
The workers are pretty nice. 
The place designs are well colorful just like the menu too.
Boba are the best.
author: Victor C.

description:
Two stars for the decor/design of everything. 

What i really like is how clean and fresh the inside decor looks. The seats aren't the most comfortable but they do match the decorum inside. They also have these pretty awesome looking big tea pots that they keep tea in.

Onto the drinks. I ordered an iced milk drink with chocolate, boba and pudding. The pudding was flavorless. The boba was hard in the middle yet super soft on the outside. The drink itself also didn't have any flavor nor did it even have a milky taste. The only thing that I tasted was some of the chocolate syrup. Not good.

My friend's black milk tea was refreshing but just alright.

All in all, nice inside, cute logo and menu, but my drink was definitely lacking in all aspects.

Before I forget, the drink also took a long time. We got in there at 12 o'clock and didn't leave for 15 minutes even though there was only one other person waiting for a drink.
author: Wilson T.

description: I'm sorry For the bad review but I can't take it anymore I came here 3 times one time my friend was working and she made me a pretty decent milk tea but I asked her if she could make it sweetener which she greatly did. But the other 2 times I went ther and they mad my drink wrong when I asked them to add some sweater they just took it back gave me a glare n a min later gave it back to me without adding anything n trust me it tasted like water with cream. There was no tea flavor In it. The only reason I would giv it 3 star is for my friend who is so kind to help me adjust my drink to my likening
author: Kelly C.

description: This place is great, the tea is awesome and the staff is amazing. It's a great little place to go to if your craving for sweet tea or just want something sweet to drink and it's very affordable also.
author: Jesse S.

description:
Stumbled upon this place on yelp, while searching for a new boba spot in the sunset. Giving it 3 stars because it was A-Ok....it wasn't anything special, tastes like any other boba places.

Ordered the iced milk drink with caramel, pudding, and boba. The taste was ok, they really loaded up on the boba which made the drink kinda watered down. But overall, if you're craving iced milk drink in the sunset, give this place a shot then probably avoid later on.....FYI it's cash only, so make sure to have that on hand.
author: Julia K.

description:
I walked by this place yesterday and noticed they would be opening today. 
I walked by and noticed for the grand opening they were giving a 35% discount. 
Before I went in, I looked at the menu. OK they have teas and a few snacks. 
I went in there about 3 something in the afternoon.
As I placed my order I was told they were out of regular boba. So I chose popping boba. 

I checked my receipt. There was a discount given, but I was charged for the popping boba. OK, whatever. 

I was waiting for my drink and the person who ordered before me was told there wasn't any more shaved ice. So the owner suggested she get a drink instead that had milk in it. Now, I think the menu should say there is milk in most of the drinks and maybe have an alternative for those that can't handle milk.

I got my drink and it was larger than regular size which I didn't mind. I had a sip and it tasted like green tea, but a little off. I tasted the popping boba and I think it's something that's like a skin around it and then there's liquid in the middle. Like some sort of candy but a soft shell.

Overall, my impression of the place was that they needed to have more inventory instead of running out. Have the cashiers tell you that the receipt has the number of your order. The cashiers should also note that if you do want a "topping" that it'll be $0.50 extra. It does note it on the menu, but it's on the bottom. There are many flavors to choose from, and some sort of grid, but why have letters with the drink if you can't order it by the letter?

I hope that next time I do go, they'll be better prepared and in stock with everything.
author: Jen C.

description: Goooooodd honeydew black teaaaa! I'll comeback and try for some more!! Gotta give this a try instead of just trying what's near sf. This place aint that far! Must try!
author: Olivia J.

description:
I really like this place. Much better than Quickly for example. I like taste and how they are making this milk tea. Before they give it to me they try what their making... I think this is really cool. I'm upset that they don't have other cafe in the city. 
I can definitely recommend it. 
One thing... I think opening at 12 it's too late.
author: Anastasia G.

description:
Pretty good, standard milk tea. Had the black milk tea with boba. Watch out though, the milk teas can be on the sweet side! I ordered my drink light sweet but it was still pretty sweet like it was a normal sweetened milk tea. It makes me wonder how sweet 'normal' would be. 

I wouldn't go out of my way to come here again, but I definitely would if it's nearby. This will probably be my to go place for boba since I work down the street!
author: Allyson W.

description: It's great to see another business open up in the neighborhood, very friendly staff.. So far I had the iced milk w/ caramel & pudding & boba, iced milk w/ chocolate & pudding & boba and the iced milk w/red bean & boba.. All three were good not to sweet, the boba was firm not smushy... The iced milk drinks run $3.65
author: jonathan h.

description: Strawberry drink was so good looking forward to going bak n trying other drinks...n some chiken wings
author: Lorena S.

description: Sorry Tpumps looks like I am never lining up 45 minutes for boba again. BB Tea Station is my go to place for boba. The line is short, the employees are nice and the menu is extensive. You can also alter the sweetness if you have problems with sugar. The boba is always consistent and they have special flavors I haven't seen in other places such as lavender and caramel. My personal favorites are caramel black tea 50% sweetness, lychee black tea 25% sweetness and strawberry black tea 50%. Don't give up if you got a drink that tasted off, try another and you will be happy you did!
author: Jayne A.

description: Matcha Lattea and honeydew milk yea are my regular drinks. I usually go with these two just to be safe. I've tried other drinks such as rose milk tea, taro milk tea etc. they usually don't come out as flavorful. But overall still one of the better milk tea places.
author: Amy C.

description: Let me start off by saying that the almond milk tea was delicious! Perfect to my liking but like the previous post, they ran out of Boba before 6 pm and the drink took a bit longer to prepare than most places but it's not powdered almond tea like those fast serve places. It is also a little pricier but the drinks are pretty large. I'd prefer a smaller portion though to pay less. It was a busy place for a Sunday evening and the menu had over 20 flavors. It's also open till 10 PM most days which is a plus for my study dates. Not sure if they have wi-fi yet but hoping they will. What's spectacular about the place is the extra seating in the back with a couch and seating outside in the front with some plants and good lighting. I will definitely come back especially at 15% off for the grand opening.
author: Crys L.

description:
This is like my triple times a week thing now ! I am officially a fan of BB tea station ! 
Before BB tea station opened , I usually go to Eggettes or T Pump for some milk teas or green teas. 

I love the environment in BB tea station , it has some nice decoration and set up so friends can hang out there . They provide some typical Chinese board game that most of the peoples are familiar with . My all time favorite milk tea is the lavender milk tea and red jujube red tea . It is super tasty and they use real ingredient to make those drinks . 
The price are around $2.75-$3.50 per drinks , which is totally worth it for a tall cup of milk tea !
author: Priscilla F.

description: The drinks here are good for both fruity and tea based. The first time I came here I ordered Lychee Milk Tea and it was sweet but not overpowering. The second time I came here, I got a regular Jasmine Milk Tea and I really liked it. The thing about this place is that it's CASH ONLY but it's good for its price. Overall, I would come here again.
author: Vicky L.

description:
My favorite place for healthy tapioca drinks. Every drink is made to order. Tapioca / Boba is very fresh & chewy with a slight sweet taste. I LOVE & support this small local business conveniently located on Noriega street in the sunset district of San Francisco. 

***Very generous portion cup size & the tea is freshly brewed every day. Price is reasonable and a fun stamp card can exchange for a free drink of your choice. This place is like I am going to a friend's house. It is comfortable and clean. The girls in the store are very nice and respectful to customers. It is a lovely place for a nice drink!
author: Cannes N.

description: This place is an great experiment for boba Milk tea! They used fresh brew tea leaves,and it's taste amazingly relaxing.My favorite cup is the lavender MilkTea...awesome! Gotta try this place again!!
author: Connie H.

description:
Went here for the first time last week -- I've tried a lot of boba places around the Bay Area and this one is decent. They don't have a huge variety compared to Tapioca Express and Quicklys, but a good amount to satisfy anyone's taste buds (hopefully). I also tried their chicken here, which isn't that great.. came with six chicken wings and it took awhile, maybe a good 10 minutes. It was okay, nothing special; I had better chicken wings.

All in all, drinks are good, food, not so great. Also, cash only!
author: Diana T.

description:
food: almond bubble tea. it was good. but nothing different from any other places. ***3/5

service: order and go. fairly quick. went to the restroom and got back to my order. ***4/5

atmosphere: caters to a younger crowd. the seats are horrible by the way. maybe my butt is just too big, but the seats are incredibly small. ***3/5

value: can get pricey if you do extras. but not too bad. classics are pretty fair. ***4/5
author: Andy Z.

description: Delicious boba. Like the balls. The tea is also good, though I only had the chocolate. There's a lot of flavors though, so I'll go again.
author: Sean M.

description:
Cute little new place! 

They have a variety of drinks and i love how their menu is organized! 

Ordered the Caramel with grass jelly and boba milk and it was alright. It's super sweet, not like purple kow sweet (creamy) but it's just sweet. The caramel isnt mixed/blended in with the drink, it's all on the sides. 

Although offering talmost the same drinks as purple kow at a cheaper price it's okay, nothing great or special. I won't go out of my way to come here but i'll definitely come by when in the neighborhood! 

They also offer pots of tea if you just want to sit down and enjoy some fresh tea as well!
author: Windy L.

description: I really like how the tea is freshly made when you order it but the wait is too long. I went there and there was barely anyone yet I waited around 30 minutes for my drink. I don't think it was worth the wait. Plus, the menu for ordering is a bit confusing. Other than that, I thought this place was decent. Not too bad but not too good.
author: Ruby C.

description:
Another alternative to Tpumps - Fantastic!

Extensive menu so this is only based on a few items. 

Ice milk wasn't as good as other places so I wouldn't order that again. Flavored milk tea was good and almost reminded us of Fantasia. Would never go to Tpumps again!

Oh and this place uses better quality lids compared to Tpumps - Talk about major steps forward!
author: Con L.

description: A very nice place to night out with some friend . And they have hot drink and cold drink . I like to ice milk drink and the yogurt drink a lots . Easy parking . And nice ppl working there . Omfg I love the cute menu and the baby cow cow logo .  Omg and they close at 12am . So I can do my home work there and enjoy my ice milk drink or yogurt yogurt drink ;) mummmm yummy
author: Baybay S.

description: Really good! The lavender green tea is a favorite of mine. It wasn't too sweet either.
author: George Z.

description: Not a big fan of their milktea...all I taste is milk and sweet I can not taste no tea...
author: Alicia W.

description: I decided to try this considerably new boba place with my sister and it was ridiculously bad. Honestly, it was the absolute worst drink I ever drank. I ordered the plum green tea and it was literally bitter green tea with two pieces of dried plums at the bottom. I couldn't even finish it, I took two sips and had to toss it out. I'm not even trying to sound like a food snob, but seriously this was probably the worst drink ever! My sister ordered the regular bubble milk tea with boba expecting nothing special in particular. However, we were both bombarded with a mouthful of sugary sweet milky drink. There was no tea flavor at all! I mean I thought it was suppose to be milk TEA, there was no tea in there at all. The other drink we ordered was a taro milk tea and it wasn't the typical purple color, which was surprising. This was the better of the drinks, but it had no taro flavor and tasted like a watered down regular milk tea. The one star I'm giving is specifically for the decor and unique/confusing menu. For goodness sake, even the Jenga sets were all messed up and the pieces were all different sizes.
author: Celina C.

description: This place is way better than I expected it to be. The name and theme are a little odd, but their boba is really good! I decided to order the almond green milk tea, which tasted really light and refreshing and not too sweet. The boba had the perfect chewy texture and tasted just like honey! They have lots of different teas and other toppings to choose from too. The only thing I didn't like is the fact that they take longer to make your drink compared to other boba places, but hopefully that just means they're taking the time to produce good quality drinks!
author: Stephanie G.

description: Not bad! But a little bit too sweet, so I recommend getting half sugar or 1/4 sugar =p
author: Tina W.

description: I absolutely love this place.  The drinks are amazing and the service is really good for an Asian bubble tea place.  I like the fact you can order yogurt drinks as well.  They have a good variety of drinks to choose from.  I usually order the pomegranate yogurt.  You can order it with or without toppings, but the yogurt drinks are so delicious!  Be sure to get a stamp card because I'm sure you'll be back.  Tastes better than purple kow and you won't wait nearly as long.  10 stamps and you get a free drink.  Delicious goodness in a small refreshing, cute package. :-)
author: John H.

description: Went here about 2 weeks ago with friends. Pretty good, the tea wasn't too watered down or too sweet so yay
author: Emily P.

description: I ordered BB milk drink with caramel, boba, and pudding. I love it! It's milk slushy, which I haven't seen in any other milk tea place. Egg pudding is tasty but boba is a little bit hard. I'll come back for this drink again.
author: Sandy C.

description: I always come here once a week or maybe sometimes 2-3 times a week and get the matcha milk tea. Other places usually only add a little bit of matcha powder but at bb, they add enough powder that you can actually taste the matcha. The boba is always at the right consistent and the sweetness is always to my liking. The employees are super nice and the guy that seems like the manager always makes my drink perfect. The place is also very cute and a little unique compared to other places. I actually come here more than tpumps because there are rarely any lines and tpumps does not have matcha milk tea. I love this place, I definitely recommend :)
author: Brenda K.

description: My new favorite boba place. The G5 is great to soothe that sweet craving and the mango black tea is great for a drink with a meal. The workers are nice and friendly. Great service. The line is always short and the drinks come out fast. I highly recommend this store!
author: Sam W.

description: I love this place (mostly because it's so close to my house). It's pretty cheap and friendly and they have board games, which is cool
author: Kira L.

description: Love their drinks, my favorite is the hot ginger black tea :) perfect amount of sweetness & love that kick of ginger!
author: Ann Z.

description: Not the best tea place I've been too. I ordered a lychee green milktea and they took forever to make my drink. When I received my order, there was milktea or sugar on the outside of my cup which was a mess to clean up. As for the milktea, I couldn't taste much of the tea. It was only lychee flavor and sugar (sweetness). The boba was decent but overall, the drink wasn't good enough for me to come back. I wouldn't recommend this place for anyone who prefer a rich tea taste in their milktea.
author: Sephina H.

description: now if I actually checked in here as much as I actually went in it would be like I lived here. I first came here when it opened about two years ago? I can't believe it actually took me this long to write a review. Personally I love bb tea station. Their drinks have a milky taste to it which I love. A lot of people thought their menu is confusing and as did I in the beginning but it only took a minute to figure it out. The decor is adorable and they have board games and TV inside. Also with free wifi! The staff is super friendly here! I've been there so much all the staff knows my usual so I don't even have to say it ! Even the owner knows what straw I use! Im not really sure what their boba taste like since I only get grass jelly or no topping. My favorite drinks here has to be lavender black milk tea and lemon honey green tea. I usually ask for extra sweet in all my drinks but they already pretty sweet on its own. I love it here and you should try it out as well!
author: Kayla F.

description: Looking for milk tea, I messed up and bought their BB iced milk instead of milk tea. When I tried it I fell in love instantly. Everywhere else I went with milk cant compare to the milk here. Milk is awesome.
author: Tony D.

description: first time to order, and was so happy that i liked all my orders! not too sweet! except for a little pricey!
author: Tae N.

description: The ice milk drink is my favorite!  They also have lot of other flavors and you can control the sweetness of the drink! Very good service and fast too!
author: Mable L.

description: Solid milk tea with whichever flavor they have on the menu. Choice of Black or Green Tea. Fair price at around $3-5. Wait is prompt and would go back.
author: Scott Y.

description: Happened to pass by on my way to dinner and decided to try their equivalent of Purple Kow's D3.  I forgot what the specific name of the drink was, but it was pretty good.  Pudding and tapioca were both tasty and had good texture.  Net take away is it's not as good as Purple Kow, but I'd consider again if I happened to be in the neighborhood and didn't have time to drive/wait at Purple Kow.
author: Erick L.

description: Boba was pretty sweet,very similar to tpumps. Just overall I didn't like how they had a conversation with their co-workers when for 5 minutes straight when there was 3people waiting.
author: Jefferey L.

description: My girlfriend brought back milk tea from this place. Thai iced tea and milk tea with caramel and boba. Both of them were just about tasteless. It wasn't that there wasn't enough sugar. It's just that the taste was disappointing in a way that can't be put into words properly. Probably the weakest tea I've ever had from a tea place like this. Hopefully it was a one off
author: Dj D.

description: Great place, a lot of people go in here and that made me try out this place. They have some of the most amazing iced tea out there. I love it when they put a lot of mint on mine.
author: Steve Y.

description:
Great iced milk drink... Loved it.

It's my first tome here, ordered the caramel boba with pudding iced milk drink... I think it tasted better than purple kow across the park and half and half in so cal.

However, have to try it again to really get a good gist if it...
author: Danny H.

description:
Came here expecting the typical tapioca/boba place(like the rest of them in the Bay Area), but I was really surprised by their smoothie boba. It was delicious! 

I had the G-5 it was yummy, boba was nice and tender unlike some other chewy bobas. Also service was great! Talked to the owner, who was very nice & explained their menu to us. Would come here again!
author: Ric C.

description: Not bad not bad. I like the decor inside and the chart is really useful if your a first time boba drinker. D got the pineapple milk tea, which was surprisingly tasty! Didn't think I would like pineapple! But besides that, not much to be impressed with. I did notice that the drink started to separate after a few hours, which is kinda gross in my opinion. Where's the real milk and dairy guys?!
author: Jessica H.

description: I came here during the grand opening. It was very busy so I expected the longer wait on my drink. I ordered a lychee snow ice with aloe vera which is a slushy. It was really good, especially on a hot day. Very refreshing. The size of the drink is kind of big. They also seem like they have some interesting flavor that i will be coming back to try.
author: Debbie Y.

description: Out of the boba places I go to this one is only in the middle of them. Its not too bad, but not outstanding. Also sometimes certain drinks seems like they have a weird flavor to them, but overall a okay place to go to. I would avoid any of the iced milk teas and stick to the normal milk teas.
author: Lawrence Y.

description: Very nice staff, cute little place with some board games.
author: Karen J.

description: It is the worst feeling to wake up from food poisoning at the middle of the night! All the cold sweat and dizziness!! Won't be back again!
author: Amy Y.

description: I ordered a coconut milk tea with boba ! Tastes good though, I like the boba because it was sweet enough so I guess they put brown sugar in. if they can make it little bit soft will be much better !  Also the menu looks nice but too confusing !
author: Ava L.

description: I've walked past this place so many times and never really paid attention to it since it was always empty. It popped up on my yelp feed one day and it had a good amount of reviews so I finally decided to try it! I got the iced milk tea with boba and it definitely wasn't bad! Now because there was blended up ice inside, it kind of made the tapioca balls hard. The ones that I got fast enough before they hardened were pretty soft, so I'm pretty sure their bobas are on point! Drink looked pretty plain but it was nicely flavored and wasn't overly sweet. Service was good too (then again, there was only a few other people inside) and the cashier was nice enough to tell me to stir my drink since I wouldn't have known if she didn't! Will definitely come back to try their other drinks to see how they compare... hopefully they don't disappoint. Now I will have a boba place in between Geary and Irving... WOOT WOOT!
author: Johnson S.

description: I have been taking my grandkids to BB Tea Station since it opened but never took the time to do a review.  Our grandkids got both us grandparents into drinking BB Tea Stations' drinks.  Today I decided to write a review after going to the new tea place down Noriega St.  Now I know why we like BB Tea Station and are a repeat customer.   They have lots of choices and their tea is not bitter.  We do not order the bobas but have jellies with our tea drink.  Service is good.  They even know what my grandkids want since they always order the same drink.
author: Em D.

description: What a great place for a tea party! Ray the owner was so friendly and welcoming to our study group! Nothing beats studying with friends while drinking delicious and flavorful tea! If you're in the sunset this place should be on your list! Thank you Ray!
author: Hadas Z.

description: Since I just moved to the sunset, one of the first things on my list was to find a good boba place nearby. Luckily my timing was really good as bb tea station had its grand opening the same weekend that I moved here. The menu was a little bit confusing at first, but nothing that knocks off stars or anything. When I came in today they also gave me a sample for coconut milk green tea (so yummy -- will definitely order next time!) while I waited, so that was a nice gesture. The boba were a little bit hard, but still very yummy, and the tea has been delicious both times I've been here. The locale is cute, and while I haven't tried it, there is free wifi here, so I think I've found my new work space :) this is definitely a place I know I'm going to spend a lot of money at while I live nearby :)
author: Vilde E.

description: First time here. Ordered ice milk drink with taro, and a friend ordered ice milk drink green tea w/ boba. Don't really like taro ice milk drink because of the shaved ice, but green tea ice milk drink is okay though. I don't think that I will be coming back often at this place.
author: Trinh L.

description:
I'd give this place 5 stars if they didn't have such a complex menu. I almost always get the iced milk drink when I come here, although I ask for it less sweet cause they always put a ton of sugar in it. They take a while to make one drink and they do it behind this wall-- kinda sketchy. 

Oh and when they tell you to stir well, stir very well.
author: Kendall M.

description:
Just went here because it right by my house. Every boba place I go, I always get a HoneyDew SnowIce, or Smoothie, or whatever that shop's version of it is.  I went in, the lady was quiet and barely could hear her.  No one else was there which I thought was odd - 

 I ordered a HoneyDew Snow Ice w/ Tapioca, for right under $5. 
it comes out LITERALLY 45 SECONDS LATER, it was half water, half ice, barely any flavor, barely even blended and a neon green color.  Albeit, the boba tapioca itself tastes ok. 

I took a few sips and threw it out right away. It was almost embarrassing how it looked and the lady who gave it to me just swished it across the counter.  I think they knew.  Go to the boba place down on Irving for the good quality stuff.

I will never return here.
author: Mona Z.

description: I love the interior. nice and clean...Like their iced milk drink, but make sure you tell them to get less sweet if you dont like sweet things like me that much. Matcha milk tea is good too and they also have their winter special drink. HOT CHOCOLATE! great place to hang with friends.
author: Vicky Z.

description: The black milk tea with egg pudding is sooo good! Very sweet and refreshing! This place is a hidden gem in the sunset!
author: Annie N.

description: very new, very clean, and very full of suck. tea tasted like sugar milk and the boba has a terrible texture when you chew into it.
author: Sherman L.

description: Excellent hospitality and very friendly manager!  A great place to hang out or do homework at, they can even provide some tutoring up to undergrad level in engineering and most g.e. classes.
author: Cheuk L.

description: I was not impressed with this place. My drink flavor (taro) was a bit boring, it didn't have many tapioca balls in it and they don't even have that machine which seals plastic over the top so my drink kept splashing everywhere. One positive is that they have internet but the inside of the cafe is under-decorated and not that comfortable so I didn't want to stay long. All I have to say is you can definitely find better boba in sf.
author: Erin W.

description: This place is super cute!!!  I found this place online and just wanted to give it a try, it was surprisingly good!!!!! The sweetness level is perfect for me!!!!!  This place is a very comfortable spot for hang out with friends, unlike other bubble tea places. I also tried drinks at T Pumps, Honey B Tea and Purple Cow.  They are either too sweet or the drinks are just ok.  I would want to come back again for the delicious milk tea.
author: Michelle Y.

description: Im a boba milk tea drinker. This place is so NOT good. All i taste is sugar and milk. So sad. I was happy to see that there is a new boba milk tea close by my house but this place really sucks.
author: T K.

description: I was walking by to go to the nail salon a few doors down and happened to walk in because a cold boba sounded good to have while getting a pedi.  I like green tea and lattes so I ordered the green tea latte, less sweet.  Overall, it was a lighter tasting milk tea - pretty balanced between the tea, milk and sweetner.  I'm used to having stronger tea tasting bobas but I like this one.  Line was short; didn't have to wait long for my order.  Cash only.  I'll be back.
author: K L.

description: Only came in once so far, ordered a peach green milk tea, regular tapioca. Seriously one of the better milk teas I've had in awhile. Sweet, light, boba was delicious and the texture had perfect consistency. I'm definitely coming back.
author: Ashely S.
